[h1] Library of Ruina - A Mesmerizing and Challenging Tale of Dark Intrigue [/h1]

[u][b] Rating[/b][/u]: 4/5

[b] Library of Ruina [/b] is a game that masterfully combines elements of strategy, deck-building, and visual novel storytelling to create an immersive and intriguing experience. Developed by Project Moon, this unique gem offers a dark and captivating journey that will keep you hooked from beginning to end.

At its core, Library of Ruina is a card-based strategy game set in a mysterious library where characters from various dimensions gather to engage in deadly battles. As the Librarian, you must strategically deploy your employees and their unique cards to overcome the challenging foes known as Guests. Each battle requires careful consideration of positioning, card synergy, and resource management, adding a layer of tactical depth that keeps you engaged throughout.

The art direction in Library of Ruina is striking and visually stunning. The character designs are beautifully crafted, with a blend of elegance and darkness that perfectly captures the game's unique atmosphere. The library setting itself is exquisitely detailed, creating an immersive environment that draws you further into the game's intriguing narrative.

Speaking of the narrative, Library of Ruina offers a captivating storyline filled with dark secrets and mysterious encounters. The visual novel segments between battles provide insights into the library's enigmatic world and its inhabitants. The writing is compelling and thought-provoking, immersing you in a web of intricate lore and character relationships. It's a game that rewards exploration and encourages you to unravel the mysteries that lie within the library's depths.

The deck-building aspect of Library of Ruina is deep and rewarding. As you progress through the game, you acquire new cards, unlock powerful abilities, and customize your deck to suit your preferred playstyle. The wide variety of cards and strategies ensures that each battle feels unique and offers ample room for experimentation. The sense of progression and discovery as you acquire new cards and unlock character stories adds an addictive layer to the gameplay.

The difficulty of Library of Ruina is worth noting, as it can be quite challenging. The game demands strategic thinking and careful planning, and the learning curve may be steep for newcomers to the genre. However, overcoming the challenging battles brings a satisfying sense of accomplishment and progression, making the journey all the more rewarding.

One aspect that may divide players is the repetitive nature of battles. While the strategy and deck-building elements remain engaging, some players may find the battles feeling repetitive after extended playtime. However, the allure of the unfolding narrative and the desire to unlock new cards and storylines often outweigh this minor drawback.

[b] tl;dr: [/b] Library of Ruina is a mesmerizing and challenging game that seamlessly blends strategy, deck-building, and visual novel storytelling. Its striking art direction, captivating narrative, and deep gameplay mechanics make it a standout title in its genre. Whether you're a fan of strategy games, deck-builders, or intriguing narratives, Library of Ruina offers an unforgettable and immersive experience that will keep you enthralled throughout your journey in the mysterious library. Prepare to delve into the difficult but rewarding depths of the unknown and uncover the secrets that lie within.

applist.name: DayZ Livonia
applist.detailed_description:
Enter Livonia. Teeming with wildlife, ruins, and hidden locations, Livonia offers 163 km2 of fields, forests, and mysterious landscape – a unique new experience that will appeal to newcomers and DayZ veterans alike.




Explore the land. An exciting variety of undiscovered locations awaits the brave and adventurous. Explore murky swamps, abandoned hunting cabins, sawmills and deforested areas, as well as massive quarries containing stashes of leftover explosives.




Follow the bear. Livonia’s food supply is scarce. If you want to survive, you’ll have to learn how to hunt, fish, and forage in the unforgiving wilderness. Luckily, the land appears to be more alive now than it ever was before the apocalypse.




Discover the secret. Venture south and find the hidden entrance that leads to a mysterious underground complex. Make sure you’re with a friend while you look for a way in. And don’t forget to bring some supplies, especially a flashlight. Otherwise you might get lost in the darkened maze of corridors awaiting all who enter.

Is Livonia a pretty map yes sure.. tho it feels like I run though the fields more than anything else. 
Wish the DLC was free or that I could have returned it but played past the allowed refund time. 
This map is buggy as all get out. It’s not just me as I play with others and they too get the same joys as me. 
We will but running through a town and open a door or jump out a window or fence and low and behold we sit there falling through the map and at no prevail just falling and falling and falling. Does not correct itself at all and you have to log out. 
What really sucks when this happens is when you get smacked by a zombie you get sent to the underworld and just fall legs dangling forever getting your butt handed to you but unable to defend yourself and die. Only way to correct this is logging out and back in which if you are getting beat by a zombie or two don’t think you are coming back among the living with that character, that character has joined the zombies and and one with them and you get a fresh new character. 
Fix that issue and this map/game would be amazing. Game has so much potential to be an amazing game!

should be free

applist.name: No Man's Sky
applist.detailed_description:
Inspired by the adventure and imagination that we love from classic science-fiction, No Man's Sky presents you with a galaxy to explore, filled with unique planets and lifeforms, and constant danger and action.

In No Man's Sky, every star is the light of a distant sun, each orbited by planets filled with life, and you can go to any of them you choose. Fly smoothly from deep space to planetary surfaces, with no loading screens, and no limits. In this infinite procedurally generated universe, you'll discover places and creatures that no other players have seen before - and perhaps never will again.

Now including...

Play with all major updates since launch: Foundation, Pathfinder, Atlas Rises, NEXT, The Abyss, Visions, the 2.0 BEYOND update, Synthesis, Living Ship, Exo Mech, Desolation and the 3.0 update, ORIGINS, Next Generation, Companions, Expeditions, Prisms, Frontiers, Sentinel, Outlaws, Endurance, Waypoint (4.0), Fractal and Interceptor.

Available for PC and Mac (see recommended and minimum specs for details).

An epic voyage to the centre of a shared universe awaits, allowing you to explore, trade, fight and survive alone or with friends.

Embark on an epic voyage

At the centre of the galaxy lies a irresistible pulse which draws you on a journey towards it to learn the true nature of the cosmos. But, facing hostile creatures and fierce pirates, you'll know that death comes at a cost, and survival will be down to the choices you make over how you upgrade your ship, your weapon and suit.

Find your own destiny

Your voyage through No Man's Sky is up to you. Will you be a fighter, preying on the weak and taking their riches, or taking out pirates for their bounties? Power is yours if you upgrade your ship for speed and weaponry.


Or a trader? Find rich resources on forgotten worlds and exploit them for the highest prices. Invest in more cargo space and you'll reap huge rewards.

Or perhaps an explorer? Go beyond the known frontier and discover places and things that no one has ever seen before. Upgrade your engines to jump ever farther, and strengthen your suit for survival in toxic environments that would kill the unwary.

Share your journey

The galaxy is a living, breathing place. Trade convoys travel between stars, factions vie for territory, pirates hunt the unwary, and the police are ever watching. Every other player lives in the same galaxy, and you can choose to share your discoveries with them on a map that spans known space. Perhaps you will see the results of their actions as well as your own...

[h1]If Spore grew up into a shallow, space-themed, open-world sandbox, with MMO-like grind[/h1]

If you have had the pleasure of playing Maxis' 2008 hit game, Spore - this game is the spiritual successor. Everything from trying to fly your spaceship to the center of the galaxy, exploring randomly generated worlds and ecosystems, to the casual combat feel. 

[u]The problem is, the universe of No Man's Sky is very shallow and repetitive, inspite of all its procedurally generation.[/u] What I mean by that, is that while the core gameplay loop (explore -> gather -> upgrade -> repeat) can be very enjoyable, [u]there is a lack of depth and variety in the gameplay.[/u]

If you are planning to get into this game, I hope you will go in with the expectations of a janky indy-project, more than a AAA blockbuster title or anything.

[hr][/hr]

[h1]Lack of Depth[/h1]

Like Spore in the space stage, the gameplay is straightforward. First, you will learn how to survive in the environment, gathering resources to fix your spacesuit and tool. Then you are left to learn about the different ways of gathering resource / making money / fighting different enemies... and that's all there is to the game.

Different worlds will have different hazards (cold/heat/radiation/acid/water) but these provides almost no difference in gameplay. You just get a different colored damage bar that you will have to refill with the same resource occasionally... Even the most basic of gameplay change, like having your laser gun overheat at different speed depending on the planet temperature, is not part of this game. Every planet also have the same gravity, every planet is a terrestrial world (no gas giants!?) and there is no exploration off-planets.

You will need to gather a variety of resources and recipes to make your life easier; but in the end, all you get is just a bigger number. No gameplay change, no interesting tradeoff in upgrades, just, finding gears with bigger number and more slots.

The alien interactions are also lacking. Though NMS tried to build a sense of mystery by having you learn the languages (literally word-by-word!), it is functionally meaningless. You can still trade and get along just fine without learning a single word.
While some encounters may prompt you to read in the alien's language, getting the answer right provides meager rewards in the long run. You can get along just fine without them, and getting those rewards only help you minimally, mostly in the early game.

[h1]Lack of Variety[/h1]

The game is extremely repetitive. You will see it, even on your first planet. 

Each world is just red/green/blue hills. The "hazards" are just different colored damage bars. Acid is green, heat is red, cold is blue, and radiation is yellow. All planets have the same gravity, just different size. No gas giants or any other interesting celestial bodies to explore. You can't even get out of your ship off-planet (and outside of space stations). Like, what do you mean I can't go and explore the asteroid belts? What do you mean I can't even fly into the sun if I wanted to!? 

The different "encounters" are repeatedly copy-pasted over and over. Cargo drops? You'll find them everywhere. Crashed ship? Same shape, same cargo, same gameplay. Artifact digs? I hope you liked the toy where you dig dinosaur bones out of clay, because this is literally all you do. Not even the positions in each encounters are randomized. It's just land, go to the same location, do the same thing, lift off, and repeat.

The missions are also just cheaply randomized go here, do this, shoot that. Alien relationship means nothing, and you just spam "learn dialect" to get yet another word then walk away. Even Spore Galactic Adventures, a game from 2009, had more gameplay variety than this game.

Which brings me to the next issue...

[h1]The Grind[/h1]

This game becomes all about grind. Go shoot that tree to get this resource, fly there and get that upgrade, repeatedly do capitalist things until you have enough money to buy a frigate that can carry all your stuff. Then go to the center of the galaxy I guess.

I'm already sinking almost 40 hours into this game, and I've been repeatedly doing the same thing over and over and over... And I really want to recommend this game, but I just can't.

[h1]The Jank[/h1]

And to wrap all this up nicely, the game is very "jank".

[u]The keyboard and mouse control scheme is probably the worst I have ever seen.[/u] It is very clear that this game was designed for controller first, and the keyboard and mouse controls were added later by someone who has never played on a PC. From the moment I booted up the game and got greeted with a "hold left mouse to press button", I knew I was in for a ride. Somehow, NMS devs has managed to make a control scheme that requires too many buttons, and also too deeply nested within its own submenus. I learnt the controls within about a day of playing, but the learning phase was absolutely infuriating.

The game is still also very buggy, [u]TEN YEARS[/u] after the game's 2013 VGX premiere. You will find generated cargo drops and plants floating / clipping into each other. The way procedural generation works is also very jank, as you will constantly find mountains and buildings fade in-out of existence while you are flying over a planet. Oh, and did I mention that your game will crash if you try to use its built-in screenshot function? Yeah, that's [i]still[/i] a thing.

[h1]Closing Thoughts[/h1]

> I love all the base-builder/sandbox games from Sim City to Minecraft, where I enjoy doing whatever the hell I pleased, without needing "objectives" to do. But No Man's Sky just doesn't have as much depth as those games.

> I love all the grindy JRPGs where I repeatedly hit different colored slime with my bigger number sticks, where I eventually get to watch the story unfold. But No Man's Sky doesn't have as compelling a narrative like those games either.

> I loved the original Spore for its carefree exploration of the universe. But No Man's Sky delivers that with jank lipservice, failing to provide anything actually interesting to explore or see, and in a completely unimmersive way.

I myself am a complete sucker for this type of games, and I really wanted to love and recommend No Man's Sky, but I just can't. I'll probably grind it just for completion, but nothing more. Spore did it better.
space

64 hours on PC - 500+ on console.
Did this game have a big poopoo launch with thousands of memes, 100% yes!
Did the developers knuckle down and work hard to update and update and update and update into one of the greatest games I've ever played since then, 300% yes!!

We all know the developers could have taken that money from launch and just ran with it, but I have huge respect for the commitment they put into the title post launch and the pride they take in the game.

This game isn't perfect, but it feels good supporting a developer that stood by and continued to grow their game for 7 years and still going and I always enjoy popping in
Keeps getting better and better.  Been playing since the initial release and have never needed to shell out another penny for all of the upgrades.  Good job guys!
Nobody will read my review, so I'll just say i'm gay.
I pirated the game in 2016, then bought it on Steam in 2019, and bought it on PS4 in 2021. They deserved every penny that I have throughout the years!!
Excellent execution on moving this game to Mac. The support for MetalFX and the Apple Silicon has been spot on for me.

Wow... Just... Wow...

I never played NMS when all the negativity was plaguing the game, but after it started taking off I dabbled here and there. I finally dove in a few months ago just to see if I would enjoy it. This is THE space survival game, no other game even comes close. If you're into survival games that is this is an absolute treasure. Not to mention the fact that they haven't done the whole Paradox thing and released 50 DLC at this point, all content has been free.

My ONE complaint, and it's probably just because I haven't spent enough time in the game. Is the whole "Expedition" mechanic. If you're familiar with Seasons from other big MMOs it's of the similar vein. I'm just not sure if "I" find them fun, doesn't mean that you wont of course.

As far as price goes, 60$ is a pretty steep cost. I personally try to buy everything on sale and rarely buy games at full price. The amount of content in this game though is easily more than your average two AAA combined, maybe even three.
u can do the star wars hyperspace traveling STONKS
This is one of the best games I've ever played. If you like games where you collect resources, build a base, etc... (Ark, Rust, etc...) and you love sci-fi then this game is for you!
Only criticism i have is the unintuitive star map navigation

Buy it when it's on sale for half off to get your money's worth. It's a good time sink, but the content lacks real variety and the combat is pretty sad. It's very easy to become nearly invincible. The only point of the multiple galaxies full of planets seems to be a size contest with Elite Dangerous or something, since they get really repetitive, really fast. The main mission storyline is pretty good if a bit predictable for the attentive. The refinery is your friend - look up the recipes because they make no real world logical sense.
spotted a giant underground centipede thing. this game is awesome
It is simply a MUST BUY for every space exploration enthusiast. Cant get enough of it. BADASS SEAL OF APPROVEMENT!
Fantastic game. The port to MacOS run great!

applist.name: Gunfire Reborn - Artisan and Magician
applist.detailed_description:
Artisan and Magician are coming on stage!

  • Two new heroes will join your adventure. You can choose to either strategically command the power of the star cardor summon a mecha to fight alongside you. At the same time, they also bring four new weapons, including a submachine gun, a compass, an squid, and... a brick that conceals subtle golden sheen.

2 New Heros

  • Zi Xiao: He can use the quality of occult scrolls to divine the astrological aspects. The color of the astrological aspects would affect the power of the cards. When all colors in the astrological aspects are the same, it can enhance the attack of the stars against enemies.


  • Nona: Fight alongside with self-crafted wooden mecha. The mecha can both charge into battle to draw enemy fire and defend a position while providing powerful fire support.

4 New Weapons

  • Brick: Beneath its simple and unassuming appearance lies the starlight that drops when you hit enemies' weak point.It can only reveal its true power once you pick it up.


  • Jet Octopus: Absorb the water vapor from enemies and convert it into it's own energy,then exhale a powerful high-pressure water column to attack enemies.


  • Wolf Gaze: Shooting or weapon skills will stack different statuses and trigger high damage or range scatter when it is at max stacks.


  • Star Ring: Gain the power of the stars surrounding yourself in a circle and tear enemies within the expanding and contracting of stars.

About Gunfire Reborn:

  • Gunfire Reborn is an adventure level-based game featuring FPS, roguelite, and RPG elements. You could play as different heroes with their own unique abilities. In each game, the build can be different with the random drop and route. You could enjoy the Gunfire Reborn by yourself in solo play, or join a 4-player co-op.
  • In each run, the stage route can be different, and every new game means a different experience. You could choose between various ascensions, weapons and have various combat strategies for each situation.

reviews.review:
TL;DR
Zi Xiao (Owl) - Press Q till your scroll bar is full with the same color then E goes BRRRR
Nona (Red Panda) - Q shoots rockets and E lets the mech stomp at the target. Middle mouse switches mech between Brawler and Turret Mode

Good characters and they also don't feel as overpowered as Li and Xing Zhe from the last DLC. Also the Devs still support this game with free updates. Worth buying.
SHADOW WIZARD MONEY GANG. WE LOVE CASTING SPELLS.

I want to upvote so bad. The DLC itself is fine, especially if you haven't played much yet. But the devs do not make new content, they only make new ways to play the same content. It's the same levels, with the same bosses and enemies. The game really needs an actual content update not just new guns and characters.

Gaige as a red panda
Brick literally as a brick
BAAB, DO SOMTHIN'!

This DLC provides you with an absolute braindead character with 1 button nuke.
And a second character which requires you to have triple masters degree to understand the gameplay mechanics.
B r i c k 🧱 OP
It literally added a throwable brick, and it's actually shredding. 10/10. Don't nerf
Got 3 friends. 3 brick...we all had crit about x6. That poor bear didn't stand a chance.

The best designed characters so far. Zi Xiao is really unique and a ton of fun with the potential for tons of crazy builds. Nona is really fun for solo play but also as a more supportive character in multiplayer, too.

Less positive on the weapons but they're pretty alright, the main stand out is the absurdity that is the brick, which manages to be very fun and powerful. Wolf Gaze and Star Ring are pretty decent, the star ring is a little weird but good for crowd control. Do not get the jet octopus's role at all though, its soooo sluggish, by the time I get it charged i probably could've killed the enemy already with any other weapon. It definitely needs tweaking imo.

The main gripe with this DLC is, and I feel bad for saying this, is the descriptions. It's always been a problem in the game that generally eventually gets fixed down the line, but my god it's at the worst here with Zi Xiao. I could not pick up on ANYTHING that he did until I found a handy guide that someone wrote. Important mechanics unmentioned or not properly described that are critical to playing the character right, and it just expects the player to somehow know.

Normally the confusion stems from the issues that come with translation, but in this case its different. I feel like even in the original language, unless it was drastically rewritten, itd have the same problem of just... leaving critical information out. They need to rework how they relay this information to allow for more visual examples and showcasing passive or more intricate abilities if they're gonna be making these characters more complex and interesting like this. (Which is a good thing that they are!) It was a problem with Xing Zhe in the last dlc to a lesser extent too. I have to look on the wiki to know what each effect does, and if there is a way to see any of what i'm talking about, the game does not communicate it properly at all.

I can definitely recommend this DLC if you're a fan of the basegame, regardless.

Nona's mech acts as a sort of player 2 for you, reviving and fighting same as any friend you might play with. Huge win for solo runs and overall just a fun playstyle. Personally finding the Star Ring weapon a touch tricky to nail but i assume it's a good crowd control. Very cool update!
SIGMAR BLESS THIS RAVAGED WALLET (jk its only 6 dollars i love these developers so much)
dual wield bricks to punish infidels quicker.

I love owls and the owl is absolutely cracked like I'm actually addicted to how busted he is plus owls are super cute god I love owls so much he's such a little distinguished goober throwing cards at people I love him so much.
It released 2 seconds ago and I already named my firstborn child after it.

The new characters are cute and plushy.

But the game would benefit more from new stages / levels for the main game.
when we gonna get new campaign levels
Nona is best girl, fight me.

New characters are pretty cool. Owl is quite complex and definitely makes you think about the game a different way, since now picking up every single scroll that doesn't harm you may not be the best idea. New weapons are cool, though it's hard to say how viable any of them are yet. I suck with the brick :(

Only major downside is that the questionable gunfire translation can make parts of the owl difficult to understand.
Where are the bunny boobs 0/10

applist.name: Mafia: Definitive Edition
applist.detailed_description:
Mafia: Trilogy - Complete Your Collection


Includes main games and DLC releases.

Mafia: Definitive Edition
Re-made from the ground up, rise through the ranks of the mafia during the Prohibition-era. After an inadvertent brush with the mob, Tommy Angelo is reluctantly thrust into the world of organized crime. Initially uneasy about falling in with the Salieri family, the rewards become too big to ignore.

Mafia II: Definitive Edition
Remastered in HD, live the life of a gangster during the Golden-era of organized crime. War hero Vito Scaletta becomes entangled with the mob in hopes of paying his father’s debts. Alongside his buddy Joe, Vito works to prove himself, climbing the family ladder with crimes of larger reward, status and consequence.

Mafia III: Definitive Edition
After years of combat in Vietnam, Lincoln Clay’s surrogate family, the black mob, is betrayed and killed by the Italian Mafia. Lincoln builds a new family on the ashes of the old, blazing a path of revenge through the Mafioso responsible.


About the Game

Part one of the Mafia crime saga - 1930s, Lost Heaven, IL
Re-made from the ground up, rise through the ranks of the Mafia during the Prohibition era of organized crime. After a run-in with the mob, cab driver Tommy Angelo is thrust into a deadly underworld. Initially uneasy about falling in with the Salieri crime family, Tommy soon finds that the rewards are too big to ignore.

Play a Mob Movie:

Live the life of a Prohibition-era gangster and rise through the ranks of the Mafia.

Lost Heaven, IL:

Recreated 1930's cityscape, filled with interwar architecture, cars and culture to see, hear and interact with.

Re-Made Classic:

Faithfully recreated, with expanded story, gameplay and original score. This is the Mafia you remembered and much more.


Own Mafia: Definitive Edition to unlock Tommy’s Suit and Cab in both Mafia II and Mafia III Definitive Editions.

Learn More at http://www.MafiaGame.com

reviews.review: i cooka da pizza

Young gamers who never played the original will likely love this remake. Some older gamers who have played and liked the original may hate this reboot because it's not a 100% exact copy. I happen to fall among the latter, and since the original Mafia is my favorite game ever and holds such a special place in my heart, it would make sense for me to be picky and b!tch about the reboot, how it misses some details, how things have changed and so on. But you know what? When I played Mafia: DE I was overrun by the same ecstatic emotions that I felt when I first played Mafia and I totally loved this new rendition.

What else made this possible if not my nostalgia for the story, the city, the characters, etc.? But I didn't care - I loved it for what it was, loved to see the beauty of Lost Heaven backed by amazing visuals, loved to relive the story, loved the cars, the missions, pretty much everything. Yeah they could've worked on some characters a bit more, yeah they could've let us do some side jobs for Luca Bertone instead of simply using postcards for car missions, of course they could've let us play every part that was playable in the original instead of covering some bits with cutscenes, among a few other things. These are improvements that won't see the light of day, but I will never think that's enough to bash this game.

The game has been criticized for many reasons by the original's fans, from voice actors doing an allegedly crappy job to the gameplay being generic, and some gamers went so far as to immediately write Mafia: DE off because they saw Hangar13's name on it. I don't get it. Playing the remake I could often feel the love that the devs put into it, and not once did I think they were just doing their job making minimal effort. Mafia 1 was extraordinary in its details, it was a difficult yet rewarding game, and I suppose being so hardcore is why some of its fans can't get over the modernized remake. However, times have changed, the standards have changed, and I believe nowadays you often gotta appeal to a much wider audience than some 20 years ago if you want your game to succeed. And it probably just so happens that that audience is a tad more generic than it was in 2002.

In any case, I understand the criticism that this game got from some long-time fans of the franchise, and they definitely don't have to like Mafia: Definitive Edition. As for me, I didn't like it either. I loved it.

V: Mr. Angelo?
T: Uhh... Yes?
V: Mr. Salieri sends his regards.

-Remember that money, jobs, even best pals will come and go. But family? Family is forever.-

Great remake overall but, personally, I would still rate the original Mafia higher than this version.

The definitive edition has improved the gameplay aspect considerably & the graphics is absolutely bonkers. I actually appreciate how they have expanded Sarah's story as it feels more complete now.

But I didn't feel connected with some other characters like the way I did in the original Mafia. It just hasn't been the same with Ralph, Lucas & even Vincenzo. Also, I love the original soundtracks way more.

This is still an amazing game though. 

P.S - The race in the classic mode is still as hard as I could recall. It took like 3 weeks for me & my brother to successfully complete that race (we took turns) when the original came out. Can never forget that! 🤣🤣
Good storyline
Boys help me out, my wife said if I get 100 likes and 20 awards, she’ll buy me a new PC with a RTX 4070ti and a crate of beer this is NOT A JOKE!!!

So many games are open world with no focus on the story. Every time I look at a game in my backlog, I get exhausted just thinking about it if its open world. Although Mafia might not have the tightest mechanics, the story has so many great beats that this game can actually stand on its own two feet. It has a tight, linear focus with the 2K polish for the environments. The scenic Chicago-like city, the atmospheric music, and the interactions between the main characters make this game a joy to play through.

The Mafia Definitive Edition is a shining example of how a remaster should be done. This game takes the beloved original and elevates it to new heights, delivering a nostalgic and thrilling experience that captures the essence of the Mafia series.

I can't believe the racing mission is the same frustrating BS like in the original game. Seriously?
Just threw my controller through the window. Now I have to pay for a new window.

The narrative is well made and interesting. Music scores are pretty good too.

But the controls are awful. Just AWFUL. Combat controls are terrible. Driving controls are sluggish. 90% of the game is a driving simulator, and it sucks. Driving is an irritating chore in every single mission, and especially the race is a huge pile of shit. Also why do I have to press Enter to finish the loading screen every time? Devs, have you ever played games on PC?? We don't usually keep our fingers around Enter in case you don't know. Make it Space or left click or whatever that is more accessible. I cannot recommend a game that is nice to watch but not fun to play.

Underwhelming. 

Mafia II is a more polished and complete game than this one. Game lasts about 10 hours with a very average story and surface-level features, though it does have a few details that are nice to see and beautiful graphics to look, this feels like low effort game for the price of triple A title.
I hope whoever made this racing mission never gets another job in their life. What a way to ruin the pace of the game with a mission you need to repeat at least 50 times

Mafia: Definitive Edition is a story rich RPG based around a taxi driver who suddenly finds himself involved with the Mafia. The story is well written and the graphics really impressed me at certain times. The feature I liked the most was the street signs acting as a live GPS guide to your destination, it wasn't overly intrusive or immersion breaking. 

Overall, good game and enjoyable experience. I would recommend waiting for a sale before buying!
classic GEm

Unique and inimitable, this wonderful masterpiece will also remain forever in my memories when I tried it for the first time back in 2005.
I really appreciated this revision they created, remodeled to be truly appreciated even in 2023 by the new generations of gamers.
It's not a very long game, we're still talking about a creation made in 2002 if I'm not mistaken, then released in Europe in 2004, so you have to intensely appreciate every minute spent in the campaign.
I highly recommend it to everyone, without exception, I think it's one of those games that must be tried. You will see that Mafia 2 will be there around the corner to wink at you and lure you into its clutches.

As an Italian I only have to say about one small detail .... The conversations in the game in Italian (if played in the original English language) are obscene :D
In order not to hire an Italian actor for the dubbing, they had an English native speaker read sentences who most likely didn't even know what he was reading: D Clearly English accent, wrong tonality, wrong pauses, in short, a disaster.
All this, however, gives even more charm to the whole, makes it even more vintage.

Probably the best remake ever made, the story itself is great and the game play is closer to mafia 3 than what it used to be. If you are going for %100 of the achievements its not hard but not that easy, very time consuming as well if you dont use something like mapgenie, as pretty much everything stays unmarked. 

side missions are terrible and the only reason you should ever do them is to maybe unlock a car for the achievements

overall 9/10 game

This game is a masterpiece and i would recommend it to anyone who loves to sit down and play Story driven Games 10/10

Continue your Hacker's journey with several hours of additional mission content, new co-op difficulty modes, outfits, vehicles, and many other customization items. All at one great price with the Watch Dogs® 2 Season Pass.


Deluxe Edition

Play as Marcus Holloway, a brilliant young hacker living in the birthplace of the tech revolution, the San Francisco Bay Area.

The Watch Dogs®2 Deluxe Edition includes :
- The game
- The Deluxe Pack: 2 personalisation packs


About the Game

Play as Marcus Holloway, a brilliant young hacker living in the birthplace of the tech revolution, the San Francisco Bay Area.
Team up with Dedsec, a notorious group of hackers, to execute the biggest hack in history; take down ctOS 2.0, an invasive operating system being used by criminal masterminds to monitor and manipulate citizens on a massive scale.

  • Explore the dynamic open-world, full of gameplay possibilities
  • Hack into every connected device and take control of the city infrastructure.
  • Develop different skills to suit your playstyle, and upgrade your hacker tools – RC cars, Quadcopter drone, 3D printed weapons and much more.
  • Stay seamlessly connected to your friends with a brand new co-op and adversarial multiplayer Watch Dogs experience.

PUT YOUR EYES IN CTRL
Get the upper hand with Tobii Eye Tracking. Let your gaze aid you in weaponizing the “internet of things”, aim at enemies and take cover while you naturally explore the environment. Combine the extensive eye tracking feature set to pinpoint enemies, interact with your surroundings, locate shelter points, and rapidly select hackable targets. Let your vision lead the hacking of the city’s digital brain.

Compatible with all Tobii Eye Tracking gaming devices.
----
Additional notes:
Eye tracking features available with Tobii Eye Tracking.

reviews.review:
I was honestly quite skeptical of Watch Dogs 2 before I played it. I finally played the first Watch Dogs and found it really good, like, shockingly fun and engaging! And in the first two hours, I wasn't quite sold on Watch Dogs 2. But it clicked quickly after that and I had just as much fun with that game as I did with the first.

Watch Dogs 2 is, in my eyes at least, a Jedi Academy-esque sequel in the sense it vastly improves on it's predecessor's gameplay with no (!) downsides. These improvements include:

- noticeable smoother movement
- better cover (the cover jank from the first game is GONE)
- better driving
- better radio controls with actual dedicated radio stations
- better police (you can no longer escape even the highest wanted levels just by stepping on a boat)
- different clothing stores and more clothing customization
- improved graphics (Watch Dogs looks great, but Watch Dogs 2 has notably better reflections, character models and the indoor areas, Nudle campus being my favorite, are a highlight)
- new gadgets that are actually really useful!
- more gangs (though with less significance)
- gang warfare and police gang fights, with great fun to be had with related hacking abilities
- sailboats!!!!!
- better and actually useful sightseeing
- better car app
- VASTLY expanded hacking

and so on

All that while retaining the great sandbox levels the series is known for. Now, of course, there are a few small things that aren't improved. The finance system is improved from Watch Dogs, in particular, weapons are more expensive and hacking bank accounts nets way less money. But it still is kinda broken and before you know it, you're swimming in cash with not that many ways to spend it, in particular since your ammo still gets magically filled up around missions. Gunplay is slightly worse than Watch Dogs, didn't find it that notable though, and I REALLY liked the now-removed gang hideouts.

But overall, I was just amazed by how many improvements and additions the developers came up with. In the $911 mission, during the refinery section, I took out only the mandatory targets, snuck away undetected to the nearby pier and escaped via sailboat into the sun – that was PEAK Watch Dogs!

Aside from the gameplay, it get's less exciting. As for setting and style, it's at least cohesive, though in my personal taste, I prefer gloomy autunm Chicago any day of the week over sunny SF. Ubisoft Connect is also awful, but you know that already. The story?

The Story is, well, kinda bad. Part of this might be that I played the game in German. The german dub of WD1 is actually okay, I actually prefer german Aidan Pearce as the English dub is way to deep and raspy, perhaps further alienating players from him. The German version of WD2 is super cringe at times, in particular I cringed when they word-for-word translated things like "insulting sb intelligence" or "plausible deniability" - it just doesn't work! 

That being said there still is some cringe, in particular when they use internet/nerd slang. It feels tacked on. The story has the overarching problem that it's clearly written in reaction to Aidan Pearce's unpopularity, undeserved in my opinion. Marcus and the crew are happy, colorful people with literally zero edges to them. They also take themselves way too seriously. A small revenge subplot falls flat almost immediately and another "can I trust Ray?" does too. A good character doesn't have to be likeable, he has to be interesting. I loved WD1's story because it was interesting, cohesive (WD1's world wasn't fun or colorful, it was dark, disgusting etc. and so was Pearce's mood), atmospheric and it was serious. 

There is a real lack of cohesion and disconnect from this since as Marcus you will inevitably shoot and kill people whereas the other parts of the crew seem like peaceful college hacktivist kids. This isn't helped by the fact that the reputation system from WD1 was removed. This is porbably a good thing because it limited player freedom more than it was an interesting mechanic but it makes the disconnect even more apparent as Marcus can punch hoardes of civilians with zero impact. Marcus himself is a blank slate and until an audiolog right before the last mission, there is almost no background to him! Perhaps more importantly, the missions barely tie togehter. 

Yes, WD1 does feel strechted quite a lot but every mission was connected to the ultimate goal of bringing Lena's murders to justice. In WD2, only a few missions tie in to the overarching "defeat Blume"-goal. In short: WD2' story is LACKING.

Overall, still a clear A-tier game!
realistic cops. they always shoots first for being black. 10/10
I love gang violence

This game is pretty fun in all aspects involving the gameplay. The map is a blast to transverse, both by car and by foot because of its highly interactive world filled with cool things to mess with like the traffic lights, other cars or just bully random NPCs. The driving feels pretty good too, even though the cars might feel a little bit floaty. Also the gunplay is great, with pretty varied weapons which might feel a little bit too basic but when combined with the ability to hack the world and the gadgets available is pretty satisfying. And the side activities are pretty varied and fun too, ranging from invasions in other player’s worlds to kart racing. 

The only cons is that the story extremely cringe and feels written by an amateur out of touch millennial writer who thinks that trends from 20-15 years ago still hold up, surprisingly the characters are pretty likable. And the missions might feel repetitive too, since they tend to be an infiltration in some random building, hack something there and leave, but there are some surprises.

Firstly, I like the game, there's a vibe about it that makes me want to come back to it.
Secondly, as a Steamdeck user it annoys me that every time they update their launcher, the game breaks.

At first, the game worked flawlessly (if you don't mind the silly messages at the beginning). Then, it started randomly crashing due to memory leaks. Finally, it refused to run completely.
Now, after a complete reinstallation it works again, but I've lost too much time and don't want to play anymore.
GTAV except you hack stuff

i'd rather play wd2 than legion any day of the week i don't know how they killed the series so brutally with that third one but this is the way better really damn fun one, marcus and his crew got a whole lot more personality than aiden and his goons ever did imo plus a lot of fun new weapons and mechanics. i definitely gotta have at least 200+ hours racked on this game across xbox/ps plus the few i got on here cuz there's a lot to do in this game, you can find yourself just doing side quests all through the night or grind on the actual story since it's a pretty neat story at that. 1000% recommend grabbing this one while it's on sale!

Notice: Purchases made in this region will only receive the Russian and Simplified Chinese languages.

it is embarrassing!

I recently purchased Watch Dogs 2 with high hopes, being a fan of the original game. However, my excitement quickly turned to disappointment within the first 10 minutes of gameplay. I encountered an overwhelming amount of bugs that made the game virtually unplayable. This is the first time I've ever uninstalled a game after such a short period of time.

From the moment I started playing, it felt like the game was determined to frustrate me. Bodies were inexplicably flying through the air, and main character was performing strange sprint strafes.

I had heard rumors about bugs plaguing the game after its release, but I couldn't fathom just how bad it would be. If my experience within the first few minutes is any indication, I can only imagine the nightmare players must have faced post-launch.

Watch Dogs 2 had the potential to be a great sequel, but the abundance of bugs and glitches completely destroyed any enjoyment I could have had. Save yourself the frustration and disappointment by avoiding this game altogether. There are plenty of other titles out there that offer a polished and enjoyable experience, and Watch Dogs 2 simply doesn't belong among them.

Great game if you have a set playing time of 5 to 10 minutes before it crashes. At first it said my drivers was not up to date but after updating it i still got the same crashes. Oh but the Ubisoft crash report will help. Nope. Every time i try to send one it says it something went wrong and cant send it. Thanks Ubisoft.

applist.name: Watch_Dogs™
applist.detailed_description:
WATCH_DOGS™ COMPLETE EDITION


Experience Watch_Dogs - the phenomenon of 2014 - with the biggest edition ever!
As Aiden Pearce, a brilliant hacker, turn Chicago into the ultimate weapon in your quest for revenge.
In this Complete Edition, including the game + Season Pass, access a new game mode, weapons, outfits and missions and plays as T-Bone, the legendary hacker in a brand new campaign!


About the Game

All it takes is the swipe of a finger. We connect with friends. We buy the latest gadgets and gear. We find out what’s happening in the world. But with that same simple swipe, we cast an increasingly expansive shadow. With each connection, we leave a digital trail that tracks our every move and milestone, our every like and dislike. And it’s not just people. Today, all major cities are networked. Urban infrastructures are monitored and controlled by complex operating systems.

In Watch_Dogs, this system is called the Central Operating System (CTOS) – and it controls almost every piece of the city’s technology and holds key information on all of the city’s residents.

You play as Aiden Pearce, a brilliant hacker and former thug, whose criminal past led to a violent family tragedy. Now on the hunt for those who hurt your family, you'll be able to monitor and hack all who surround you by manipulating everything connected to the city’s network. Access omnipresent security cameras, download personal information to locate a target, control traffic lights and public transportation to stop the enemy…and more.

Use the city of Chicago as your ultimate weapon and exact your own style of revenge.

KEY FEATURES


HACK THE CITY
Watch_Dogs takes place in a fully simulated living city where, using your smartphone, you have real-time control over the city’s infrastructure. Trap your enemy in a 30-car pileup by manipulating the traffic lights. Stop a train, and then board it to evade the authorities. Narrowly escape capture by quickly raising a drawbridge. Anything connected to the city’s CTOS can become your weapon.

STREET JUSTICE
Living in inner city Chicago where violence is best answered by violence, you have the skills to take the fight to the streets. Take down enemies by delivering devastating blows with your baton, or experience a shoot-out like never before with a physics simulation that rivals anything in the shooter category. Use a combination of shooting and hacking to gain advantage in any given situation. The streets are designed for you to create your own plan of attack. Overall, you will have access to more than 30 traditional weapons.

HIGH OCTANE DRIVING
Ubisoft Montreal has partnered with studios such as Ubisoft Reflections, the acclaimed studio behind the award-winning Driver series to bring you a game bursting with horsepower. Get behind the wheel of more than 65 vehicles, each with state of the art physics and handling, and explore the massive city while completing missions.

EVERYTHING IS UNDER CONTROL
Disrupt, the all-new game engine dedicated to Watch_Dogs, uses advanced processing and graphics to deliver a stunning visual and an incredibly realistic experience. Disrupt gives you the power to affect the story, the city and the life of the population with your choices creating a ripple effect throughout the city.

DYNAMIC NAVIGATION
Watch_Dogs gives you the ability to not only use the city’s ctOS to your advantage, but the streets as well. In real-world Chicago, cut through buildings or climb to the rooftops to catch your target.

SEAMLESS MULTIPLAYER EXPERIENCE
Discover new levels of interaction, cooperation and confrontation between players thanks to a brand new multiplayer game system that links the single and multiplayer modes into one seamless experience. That means no menus, no loading screens, just instant open world multiplayer action.

applist.name: Contraband Police
applist.detailed_description:
Check out new game from our friends:

https://store.steampowered.com/app/1101120/Gunsmith_Simulator/
https://store.steampowered.com/app/1543280/Espresso_Tycoon/


About the Game

The year is 1981, and as a young officer trainee, you are assigned to work at a border post in the mountainous region of Karikatka. Entry into the Acarist People's Republic is strictly regulated by the party and your every move is monitored! The situation at the border escalates when your comrade is killed during one of the interventions...

Document control
Every visitor must have a set of valid documents. Even the slightest discrepancy means refusal of entry. Over time, the number of documents will increase and errors will be more difficult to detect.

Smuggling detection
Our intelligence regularly provides information about suspicious drivers. Search their vehicles using a UV flashlight and then use the appropriate tools to extract the smuggled goods. No amount of contraband should cross the border!

Shootouts
In some situations you will be forced to use firearms. Your station is a constant target for Oberankov's gang attacks, and every away mission carries the risk of a clash with the enemy.

Police chases
Desperate smugglers may attempt to escape from the control zone. It is your duty to stop and arrest them! Buy and upgrade police cars to improve the effectiveness of your pursuit.

Post management
Upgrade your police station to increase its defenses and improve subsequent inspections. However, keep in mind the rising cost of maintaining your station. Successful inspections, foiled smuggling and successful interventions are a few ways to earn cash.

Special assignments
Always be ready to intervene in an emergency. Solve crime puzzles, support your comrades and thwart the Blood Fist rebels. Make decisions that will determine the future of Acaristan.

reviews.review:
Some red flags to consider when shopping for "simulator" titles like this: 

1. When you click on the developer's name it redirects to the entire PlayWay S.A. catalog. It's common practice with PlayWay to obfuscate what games a developer worked on before their current one, especially when the current one is likely to gain traction with content creators (like this one, which is going to sell itself on "a 3D Papers, Please.")

2. Gunplay. Sim titles like this are a hodgepodge of mechanics and ideas, usually thrown together to pad for time. First-person shooter segments are never the strong point of a simulator title and this one leans into them quite frequently. Having spent a little time with it: the guns *could* be worse but they're in no way fluid or fun. Just bog-standard, and the only real UI to facilitate shooting is a weird red dot hovering over enemies, which feels like the result of a developer realizing all the earth tones in the map and character designs means you can't actually SEE the enemies that well. The solution: a cartoon dot that you just have to aim under to get headshots every time. 

3. Too many concepts. Contraband Police could be a solid game with just the border crossing and the idea of upgrading your outpost to be more effective. Gas Station Simulator showed you can have a really jankily-built game still have a sense of progression just by hiring AI and assigning them to do your least-favorite tasks. 

Frankly, I'd much rather not have to leave the outpost and partake of the lackluster driving sequences to travel to locations I don't particularly care for. Even the shootouts where the border post gets attacked could be interesting IF the whole point was I can upgrade my post to the point it's self-reliant. Sure, I can give my guys better guns and armor but at the end of the day, I still have to throw contraband and prisoners in a van and go run chores early-game. 

From reviews I'm seeing here, I know my dream of having a Gas Station Simulator-esque border crossing where I level up my NPCs to do menial tasks automatically (perhaps even add multiple inspection lanes and let an NPC do inspections for me with the understanding they have to flag me if any real inspection is needed) are not to be. The upgrades are purely to make things stronger when random attacks happen. 

It's aggressively okay, but I worry I'll be back to this review in a few hours of gameplay with the same story most popular simulator titles have: after the first few hours they KNOW a streamer will broadcast, it drops off. Maybe it won't. For now: buy with caution.

Fun game. I only wish the game would continue after the main quest ends.

A lot of comparisons to Papers, Please - and they're not wholly unjustified, but this is very much an action game with puzzle elements. I do enjoy that you can take your time, but even so, I missed a lot of contraband in the game. Endless mode is an absolute necessity, but even with only story mode it's pretty solid!

I would like to give a very constructive criticism; First of all, the reason why I recommend the game is that the first few hours of the game are quite enjoyable and you really have fun in the process. In my opinion, it can be tried on a discounts just for this sudden enjoyment.

But the game is starting to get extremely boring with little interaction and activities and repetitive days.

They tried to create a small world, and  it's a nice idea to take prisoners to camp or go somewhere to sell contraband, but it was a terrible way they implemented this. 
Vehicle mechanics are absolutely terrible, such a mechanic like this should'nt exist in 2023. The roads are always the same and curvy becomes boring to drive after 2 minutes since you watch literally the same environment.

Our main duty, the border guard, starts to repeat strangely after a point because we always do the same things and we don't have a proper target to improve. 

I really liked the details such as trying to interspersed with a story, murder solving, etc. It breaks the chain of being a border guard and feels like a change of atmosphere, but the story missions are too slow.

Random events that will fill every day can enrich the game. The only random event is getting ambushed by 4 raiders.  New interaction events that can be added will enrich the game. Increasing the typology of vehicle mechanics and roads/landscape and environment will positively affect the atmosphere.
At this point, you see that I played the game for 6 hours, and I played the last 1-2 hours by forcing myself. The final decision is up to you, I wrote down all the troubles I encountered here :)
It's like if in papers please was a First Person Shooter where you could actually go walk around the country in between shifts.

8/10. Will definitely come back to this game when endless mode is finally released.
P.S. Fix the mound hitboxes please devs thanks.

Title: Contraband Police: A Promising Concept Hindered by Execution

Rating: ★★☆☆☆

Contraband Police, developed by Crazy Rocks Studios, is a game that aims to simulate the intense and dangerous world of border patrol and law enforcement. While the concept holds great potential, the execution falls short, resulting in a disappointing and lackluster gaming experience.

The game puts you in the role of a border patrol officer tasked with detecting and apprehending smugglers, uncovering contraband, and maintaining law and order. The premise is intriguing, and the idea of immersing players in the challenging and morally complex world of border control is commendable. However, the game's execution leaves much to be desired.

One of the major shortcomings of Contraband Police is its lackluster gameplay mechanics. The core gameplay loop revolves around stopping vehicles, inspecting them, and searching for hidden contraband. Unfortunately, the mechanics are clunky and often feel unintuitive. Interacting with objects and vehicles can be frustrating, with poor hit detection and imprecise controls hindering the overall experience. The limited variety of tasks and repetitive nature of the gameplay quickly become tedious, lacking the depth and variety needed to keep players engaged.

Additionally, the game suffers from a lack of polish and optimization. The graphics are subpar, with dated visuals that fail to create a visually appealing or immersive environment. The open-world setting feels barren and lifeless, lacking the vibrancy and attention to detail that could have made it more engaging. Furthermore, technical issues such as bugs, glitches, and occasional crashes further hinder the gameplay experience, detracting from any enjoyment that could be derived from the game.

Another significant letdown is the game's lack of compelling storytelling or meaningful progression. There is a lack of a cohesive narrative that could have provided context and purpose to the player's actions. The absence of a clear progression system or meaningful rewards diminishes any sense of accomplishment or motivation to continue playing.

While Contraband Police attempts to create a realistic portrayal of law enforcement, it falls short in its implementation. The game fails to capture the complexity and moral dilemmas inherent in such a profession. The interactions with suspects and the decision-making process lack depth and fail to provide meaningful consequences for the player's choices.

On a positive note, the game does offer a multiplayer mode, allowing players to collaborate or compete with others in enforcing the law. This mode adds a slight layer of variety and can offer some enjoyment when playing with friends. However, it does little to salvage the overall shortcomings of the game.

In conclusion, Contraband Police falls short of its potential due to clunky gameplay mechanics, technical issues, lack of polish, and a failure to deliver a compelling and immersive experience. While the concept is intriguing, the execution ultimately hinders any enjoyment that could be derived from the game. If you're looking for a realistic law enforcement experience, there are better alternatives available in the gaming market.

its like modern day papers please. really well done with a lot more to do than just checking papers. theres also a small map to explore and gangs to fight off. highly recommend

Solid game with inspiration from "Papers Please." 

First the bad:

The overall story is pretty meh with little to draw you in. The money mechanic is really only a threat if you overspend. 

The combat is interesting while feeling out of place - why is a checkpoint inspector mowing down wave after wave of smugglers/rebels? I mean, the occasional shoot out makes sense but ambushed almost every time you run around?

Also, if there is a giant police HQ, why are you fighting these folks?

And, of course, there is a somewhat out of place stealth mission. 

The good:

This game scratches that itch "Paper's please" excelled at. You'll need to check paper work across multiple documents requiring cross references and seal verification and verifying a manifest isn't off by more than an item or a vehicle weight exceeds it's certification. 

Then, when you get a smuggler, the fun of tearing apart a vehicle and looking for smuggler stamps. There is nothing like thinking you've found every bit of contraband but then checking one last time in the engine bay only to see a pouch of contraband hidden away. 

The mundanes of transporting prisoners and contraband is fun and is coupled with an out of paying for it to be done for you if you are not interested. A blackmarket would have been nice to resell things for more than the paltry amount you get from Police HQ. 

The dev would do better focusing on the already polished inspection mechanics coupled with base building(such as a switch that deploys spikes to stop a vehicle from escaping) with the rare shoot out. More character models(women, etc.) 

There is an "endless" mode in the works I think will solve some of the issues with the campaign and the dev has shown willingness to keep building this game. With enough work, a $5-$10 campaign expansion that greatly improves mechanics would work for both the developer and fans.
Free roaming papers please

applist.name: DayZ
applist.detailed_description:
Join our Discord


About the Game

This is your Story


There are no map markers, daily quests, or scoreboards to help you create your story. There is only Chernarus – 230 square kilometers of post-Soviet country that was struck by an unknown virus, which turned the majority of its population into raging infected.

Your task? To survive the collapse of civilization for as long as you possibly can. Keep in mind that death is permanent in unforgiving Chernarus. All you’ll have when you start over again are the memories of your final mistake.

Meet Others


Up to 60 players are struggling to survive by any means necessary at any given time. Make friends, kill on sight, build a base, or risk being betrayed over a can of tasty beans. Use VOIP to interact with other players however you see fit. Every encounter is meaningful when your life is always on the line. Be wary. Stay alert. Trust no one.

Survive Chernarus


The infected aren’t the only ones you need to worry about – there’s also the wildlife and elements. Evade packs of wolves and frenzied bears, find shelter from the punishing rain, search for light in the darkness of night. You’ll also need to master complex survival mechanics concerning your hunger, thirst, body temperature, and more.

Loot Up


Always make sure your gear is ready. Patch up damaged clothes, craft improvised items, and head out to deceptively dead cities to scavenge for valuable resources. Fix a car and hide it in your secret base under a cover of well-placed traps. Step into contaminated zones if you dare and keep your eyes peeled for precious loot. Don’t forget that you won’t get far without a full hazard suit and gas mask.

Take your Shot


Intense PvP action can break out anywhere at any time, especially in hotspots like abandoned military bases, where heart-pounding firefights are all the rage. Some survivors want your loot, others are simply hunting for sport. Then there are those who are afraid you’ll shoot first. Learn how to fight and know when the time has come to swallow your pride and flee. One bullet can change absolutely everything. Always watch your back.

Install Mods


Head on over to the Steam Workshop and find a customized server that fits. Join an active community of like-minded players and modify your DayZ experience to suit your taste. Browse thousands of fan-made features, maps, and guns – all of which are easily managed directly from the game launcher.

Will you team up with strangers and stay strong together? Or play as a lone wolf to avoid betrayal? This is DayZ – this is your story.

reviews.review:
Game is about a decade old and the zombies still glitchily bounce around, phase through doors, walls, you and your attacks. Gunshots don't register, suppressed shots pull every zombie with a 20 km radius. Zombie path finding is absurd, you run through the woods, through 15 buildings across a river and over a mountain and the zombie chasing you is on your ass and not even broken a sweat. Loot spawn sucks. You get hungry / die of starvation way too quickly. Trying to constantly repair your gear sucks. Weapons break after 5 swings/shots. Sickness sucks, in the "cold" for 2 seconds? Fatally ill. The new sprain/broken leg system sucks, get hit by one zombie? Broken leg, wince and blurred screen with every step. Oh and good f**king luck finding a vehicle.

Game is just laborious.  After all this time they've made it prettier, it gets good frame rates. But what does it matter when the core game is still ass.
2k hours had some fun

Now, years later, I'm playing it with friends I'm finding it to be a buggy mess with frustrating UI. This feels like a game made by people that hate people who play games. There's very little fun about finding an item only for it to break and be useless after fighting 3 zombies or opening 2 cans of food. 2/10 and that feels generous.
You'll need at least an entire day to figure out how to play unmodded. Combat mechanics feel ancient.

Its a gruelling game where you will die again and again and again. First time you will be domed by a player over a nice looking shirt, the second time you will get mauled by one or several zombies, the second time you will find food, then shit yourself to death because of cholera or salmonella, etc. 

The game focuses alot on a kind of realism that can be alot of fun. Be prepared to use a mic in this game because players will kill you if you dont speak, typing isnt good enough. You can play all the way from an easy, +loot game, or a game where it rains constantly, theres almost no loot, and you will have to stop every 500 meters to light a fire and wring out your clothes and let them dry before you go on. Some servers let you build tents, bases, get vehicles etcetera. This game is a walking simulator on some maps, but other community maps are smaller and allows for a lot more player engagement. This game is full of stories, both good and bad, some hilarious.

I knew about this game since like, 2015 or so, but JSchlatt really made me want to play this game. THis game is hard as nails, it takes alot to figure it out, im still a big fat noob at 40 hours and i usually die before i manage to get inland, especially on populated servers where all the coasts and first towns are looted completely, since people respawn more often than they stay alive. It can be a tiresome game, i get headaches from the grass texture after a few hours of playing, i dont have anyone to play this game with, so i play solo. I reccommend this game with friends, or find a group you can play with, preferably a friend or two.

applist.name: DRAGON BALL Z: KAKAROT
applist.detailed_description:
Digital Deluxe Edition


The Deluxe Edition includes the game, a Cooking Item that gives your character permanent Ki-ATK and HP Stat boosts, and the Season Pass. The Season Pass adds 2 original episodes and a new story.


LEGENDARY EDITION


The Legendary Edition includes:
• Full game
• Season Pass (2 original episodes and a new story arc)
• Season Pass 2 (3 new story arcs)
• 2 Cooking Items that give your character temporary and permanent Stat boosts
• Tao Pai Pai Pillar


About the Game

BE THE HOPE OF THE UNIVERSE

• Experience the story of DRAGON BALL Z from epic events to light-hearted side quests, including never-before-seen story moments that answer some burning questions of DRAGON BALL lore for the first time!


• Play through iconic DRAGON BALL Z battles on a scale unlike any other. Fight across vast battlefields with destructible environments and experience epic boss battles against the most iconic foes (Raditz, Frieza, Cell etc…). Increase your power level through RPG mechanics and rise to the challenge!


• Don’t just fight as Z Fighters. Live like them! Fish, fly, eat, train, and battle your way through the DRAGON BALL Z sagas, making friends and building relationships with a massive cast of DRAGON BALL characters.

Relive the story of Goku and other Z Fighters in DRAGON BALL Z: KAKAROT! Beyond the epic battles, experience life in the DRAGON BALL Z world as you fight, fish, eat, and train with Goku, Gohan, Vegeta and others. Explore the new areas and adventures as you advance through the story and form powerful bonds with other heroes from the DRAGON BALL Z universe.

reviews.review:
Dragon Ball Z Kakarot is the dbz game I dreamed of as a kid. The game is amazing, truly the most impressive dbz game I have ever played. The gameplay is top notch it feels so fluid. The open world is perfect, there's tons of cool secrets to unfold. The game has a dope surprise if you defeat all the red enemies. The boss fights are solid. I played the first two DLC and they were pretty good although I expected more. Ill be coming back to play the other two DLC. Although the budokai games are special to me, I do have to say I think this is the best DBZ game I have ever played ! 
9/10 Amazing !!!!

[h1]Fantastic way to experience one of the most famous series in history.[/h1]
Includes all major plot points with far better graphics without some of the distracting fluff the original series had. That being said, it also includes some gameplay fluff that may be distracting but only if you let it.
For those that know nothing about Dragon Ball Z: This is an anime. Duh, right? So you can probably guess the graphics style. That being said, it is fully 3D and very well done- vastly improved upon the original series' graphics. Everything's in English, if wanted, and the storyline is a key feature of this game. You don't really need to know a whole lot about the series to enjoy this game. It is a fighting game, yes, but it feels more like a third person action RPG since there is a lot of character growth in levels, stats, and skills. I haven't beaten this game yet since I've let my son do more than half of the gaming hours I have put into it, but from what I've heard there is a lot of extensive character customization[spoiler[ after the game is won in a New Game+ fashion[/spoiler]. The fighting is very smooth and most of the time (hate it those few times whenever I can't interrupt my combo to dodge or block an attack) you can time things beautifully for a kickass experience. Fighting evolves throughout the game which is great if you want to compare it to Dragon Ball Xenoverse 2, which is basically the same combos the entire game and only super skills changing. Awoken skills, or transformations as they're called in this game, also make a difference in your fighting style which makes perfect sense. You are also able to, but not required to after the first tutorial bit, upgrade your stats and gains using a Community of characters that specialize in different things to provide you with various long-term passive bonuses of your choosing. It works using a mechanic that is similar to a gift/relationship system, but you can do it from anywhere and almost at any time.

The big complaint I have about this game: It's not cooking like people mention, it's not grinding for items like others mention in their reviews (if you don't like grinding then play on an easier difficulty so you don't have to, ya foo), it's that even though you've achieved the experience levels and orbs (orbs work like a specialized experience resource in this game) to upgrade a skill there are still many times in which you have to have a break-out battle to "train" for the skill in order to learn it and use it. This is made a little worse in the way that you can't progress further in that part of your skill tree at all unless you unlock that specific upgrade through the break-out battle (obviously you're required to win it) needed to unlock that skill. Gets annoying, especially when you're in a part of the game where it won't let you locate and use a training node. [strike]Also, even though the new skill is better in every way it doesn't automatically replace the older version of the skill? Maybe people just don't want to use more ki, w/e who cares.[/strike]
DBZ without fillers
Great game
Very fun game, dislike the random encounters though, feel like there are too many at times when I'm trying to get from point A to point B. But still love the game.
Definitely wait for when you have a controller you can play with, wish I would have known that before I bought the game.

applist.name: Warhammer 40,000: Darktide
applist.detailed_description:
Imperial Edition


About the Game


Take back the city of Tertium from hordes of bloodthirsty foes in this intense and brutal action shooter. Warhammer 40,000: Darktide is the new co-op focused experience from the award-winning team behind the Vermintide series.

In the depths of the hive, the seeds of corruption threaten to turn into an overwhelming tide of darkness. A mysterious and sinister new force is seeking to take control of the entire city. It is up to you and your allies in the Inquisition to root out the enemy before the city succumbs to Chaos.

As Tertium falls, Rejects Will Rise.




Built on the legacy of Vermintide 2’s best-in-class melee combat, Warhammer 40,000: Darktide introduces intense WH40K gunplay to the mix. Master the balance between ranged and melee combat as you fight through a slew of enemies. Feel the impact of each swipe, swing, and slice of a chainsword, or fry some flesh with a lasgun.



At its core, Darktide is a co-op game. Wandering too far, risks punishment by foes looking to immobilize or capture stray Rejects, such as the slavering Chaos Hound or the Moebian Trapper. Once you fall prey to such foes, only your teammates can save you! More than that, your innate toughness – your determination to press on through the pain – only recharges when you are in the proximity of your strike team.



Create your own, unique character and customize their physical appearance, voice, and origin. Choose your class to determine which unique traits and skill sets they will make use of in battle. Will you be a seasoned veteran of the Imperial army, a snarky outsider, or a fiery zealot? The choice is yours.




Step into the violent, dystopian world of Warhammer 40,000. From boiling hot industrial factories to the decaying water maintenance zone afflicted by constant acid rainfall - Tertium Hive is a hard and unforgiving place even at the best of times. Your role is to serve the zealous Inquisition by embarking on missions to exterminate the threats lurking in the depths of the hive city, or die trying.



Adapt to the erratic whims of Chaos with conditions- mutators that add a spontaneous challenge to your mission. Your team must learn to adjust, adopt new tactics and change up their loadouts to face these ruthless challenges.
