reviews.review: I used RNG to determine whether my review of this game with RNG crafting, RNG upgrading system,  RNG weapon shop offers, RNG mission selection, RNG mission modifier selection and RNG mission completion reward would be negative or positive.
Still not vermintide, but we are getting there.

This game is a well polished apple. It's great for those that just want to eat one apple.

But it's severely lacking for those who seek something more substantial.

fun game, basically L4D2 but WH40K

the story is nonexistent though, it's utterly pathetic
Darktide falls short in a few places compared to Vermintide, but mostly in progression. Wonderful gameplay loop but it needs time. Buy on sale.

Error Code: 3001



UPDATE 05/29/2023 - Instant game crash for AMD users. RIP.

I've been holding off & holding off on leaving a negative review for Darktide, in the hopes that Fatshark will finally get their act together and listen. After today's patch, they don't get any more leeway.

Look, the gameplay is great. The combat feels excellent. The art direction is fantastic. The soundtrack is killer. All the stuff everyone has already said before me. The issue is their management decisions focusing entirely on making things take as long as humanly possible without giving you enjoyable reasons to stick around.

Crafting is intentionally grindy, with gear options locked to only allow you to change half of the effects that are randomly assigned to it. On top of that, you have to wait & wait & *wait* for a good enough base weapon to invest your time in, only to have it roll two terrible Blessings and have your time wasted. Currency isn't shared between characters meaning if it takes you (and I'm being generous here) 100 hours to get your Veteran into a spot where you're at least satisfied with their gear, it'll take you another 100 hours to get your Zealot to the same place, and another 100 hours for your Psyker *and another 100 hours* for your Ogryn.

The mission selection is another time-waster. There are 16 playable missions on rotation at any one time, spread across all 5 difficulties. This means some maps are not in rotation when you want to play them. On top of that, missions have modifiers that add sub-objectives or raise/lower the difficulty by adding more enemies or changing how they spawn. These modifiers are *also* on rotation, so if you need to collect Scriptures or Grimoires for your weekly assignments (again, not shared across characters so you need to do 20 weeklies every week) you might have to play a difficulty that is way too easy just to grind them out (or worse, one that is too hard for you and means your team has to carry you). If you've played as much as I have, anything below difficulty 5 is boring. Difficulty 5 with Hi-Intensity is where veteran players get to really push themselves and test themselves against the worst the game has to offer... and most of them time it is out of rotation. The maps that are available are so overplayed that the community knows them by heart, adding to the grindy monotony.

Today's patch is emblematic of Fatshark's inability to adapt to what their players want. With all the issues listed above, they add a shop that adds extremely expensive recolours of old cosmetics (with in-game currency) and re-enable the FOMO rotation on their premium cosmetic shop. "But! They've added a new boss! And two new maps!", you say. The new boss is the Chaos Spawn from Vermintide 2 (their last game), which featured in the game's first cutscene so should have been in at release. Two new maps does sound great on paper, except one of them is locked behind their first community event in which the player base has to finish 900'000 missions to unlock it. And by unlock it I mean add it into the rotation so it *still* might not be playable, or might be playable but only on difficulty 3. Fatshark already know they've messed up on this front, as the mission total has come down from 1.4 million missions(!) since the first announcement.

Fatshark, I don't know what you're planning or thinking (largely because you refuse to let your Community Managers do that, despite them being good at their jobs), but you seriously need to take a look at what you have planned and think about how those plans are going to remedy the issues above. Then, give your CMs range to communicate these plans to the player base. Set reasonable goals and a roadmap and stick to it. Doesn't matter how long it takes to roll this stuff out, you've already trained your players on how to wait forever with no end in sight.

[i]„After a break spent on focus on improving Darktide, we are re-opening the premium store, featuring new sets of cosmetic items.“[/i]

[b]Players want things like scoreboard or variety of maps – not your goddamn cosmetic garbage, greedy fools [/b]

So there we were, four random rejects. Caught in the middle of a hellish swarm of chaos. None of us knew each other, none of us had any idea what we were doing, but we all knew one thing for sure. If we were going to make it out alive, we had to work together.

Our objective was simple, to assassinate an enemy HVT. We did so with ease, but the armies of chaos do not accept defeat lightly, so reinforcements stormed in.

We held, but we found that one of our battle brothers had fallen in the midst of combat and he was captured - likely to be interrogated or tortured until death.

With little ammo left, low supplies, and even lower health, we struggled to reach the extraction point which was overwhelmed by hordes of our enemies who only sought to bring us down. Three versus hundreds. Against all odds, we prevailed and made it past them.

At the final moment, before we piled in to the evac bird, we heard our fallen and captured brother calling out to us. My two remaining comrades were shaken, their morale was brittle, and their wounds fresh. They had forsaken our fourth to preserve their own lives. After a moment of weighing the risk and convincing, I rallied these men - these heroes - that no one would be left behind. Death before dishonor.

Through hails of gunfire, masses of flesh and teeth, and shell shock, we returned on a rescue mission to free our captured brother. Finding him was no easy task and rescuing him from our enemy's wretched grasp was even worse, but fate was on our side. Grateful and inspired, he led the charge all the way back to the evac zone. Now, all four of us were getting out of there alive.

Four went in. Four came out.

We did so, not for fame. Not for glory, but for honor. Certainly not the Imperium. We did so for camaraderie. We rejects do not fight for anyone but each other now. How could we have lived with ourselves? Knowing that we had abandoned our ally in his darkest moment? Honor and duty are eternal. Life is not.

Cannot recommend at time of review

Core gameplay is fun enough, but progression, loot, and gameplay modifying systems are all entirely randomized, providing little to no agency to players who would like to play the game a certain way. Want to play a specific map? With a specific weapon build? Maybe a specific challenge on a specific difficulty? You cannot choose any of these things, and can only come across them randomly. The random nature of progression also robs the player of any sense of accomplishment, as rewards are entirely random as well. It is all RNG and I cannot fathom why this is.

There are many other games out there that are just as fun and infinitely less frustrating to engage with.

"New" content is recycled from fatshark's other games and they don't really seem to care at all about giving us anything meaningful. This is extremely poor and shitty live service garbage. I do not recommend. Not now and not in the future either no matter how cheap this game becomes.
Also DO NOT BUY if you have an AMD GPU. You will experience no end of performance and network problems.
please add solo+bots its been 6 months dude i wanna play the game

Less quality of life things than the previous tide games, and an infuriatingly PURE RNG roll based crafting system that makes it nearly impossible to build your intended equipment. Good thing the gameplay is pretty fun otherwise i'd have dropped this and never reccomended it.  A lot of very questionable choices were made but if you can appreciate how 'Warhammer' the game is, then for the price, a good time can be had.

Vermintide 2 was better, but still okay / 10
WHY CAN I NOT PLAY SOLO OR OFFLINE?! I AM IN JAPAN!!! ALL THE SERVERS ARE IN EUROPE OR AMERICA!!!

A game that was launched a year early with false promises and predatory upgrade system designed to make the player keep playing the game and hopefully spend real $ on cosmetics for an incomplete game. An absolute shame since the core game play and level design is great but when there's no real story and no player agency (can't pick map/modifier) and no new maps since launch there just isn't any incentive to keep going. Last straw was team delaying communication on a big upcoming update on the same day the communication was supposed to come out. AND the excuse given (red day) was something they explicitly said would NOT be an impediment to getting the communication out on said day. Truly abysmal team from top to bottom. Community managers and any developers with self-respect should move to other companies.

Too little too late. I had my fun with it but it's genuinely frustrating to watch this games development. All of the features outside of core gameplay are a direct downgrade from vermintide 2. Why can't you choose a map and mission modifiers? Why is weapon crafting and progression even grindier than vermintides already horribly grindy progression? Why does fatshark insist on making every feature that revolves around "player retention" actively push them away? I cannot in good faith recommend this game that, despite having a core of solid gold, does not give players the freedom of choice or respect their time.
Play Vermintide instead
So releasing a content patch and not testing on AMD GPU:s and drivers making the game unplayable for over 48 hours... That's not OK  and should not happen at all in this day and age.

Great combat, great OST and sound design in general, but after 6 months there isn't most of the meaningful content promised at launch (such as a meaningful and diverse class system).
What's worse, even despite the community being mostly united and outspoken about some of the major issues within the game right now, things that wouldn't realistically take a couple months to fix, like the crafting system, #breakTheLocks and all that, or being able to CHOOSE WHICH MISSION TO PLAY without having to wait for it to be available at your desired difficulty with your preferred modifiers, there are no signs of anything changing anytime soon.

Don't buy the game, play Vermintide 2 instead. Or don't and forget about Fatshark, they do seem to forget about you after all.

I love the core gameplay of this game. It's meaty, fun and addicting.
However the surrounding features of the game is still lacking. It was launched in a way too premature stage, and the fixes and content patches have come out wayyyyy too slowly.

However the biggest insult is the latest content patch. In addition to not really offering that much new in terms of gameplay, they have the gall to reintroduce a rotating storefront that they previously had removed. It's anti-consumer, makes use of FOMO, and all for no good reason aside from trying to get people affected by FOMO to buy the cosmetics. Just make everything available in the store at all times. As much as I'd like to recommend it due to the good core gameplay, I can't due to the slow pace of updates and anti-consumer practices. Better to spend your money on games that deserve it more.

applist.name: Orcs Must Die! 3
applist.detailed_description:
Orcs Must Die! 3 ushers orc-slaying mayhem to a previously unimaginable scale. Solo, or 2 player co-op, arm yourself with a massive arsenal of traps and weapons. Slice, burn, toss and zap hordes of repugnant orcs in this long-awaited successor to the award-winning series.

New to the series, War Scenarios pit players against the largest orc armies ever assembled. Mountable War Machines give players the essential firepower to heave, stab, carbonize, and disarticulate the abominable intruders.

More of Everything - Orcs Must Die! 3 is everything fans loved about the first two games and more. More orcs, more traps, more weapons, more upgrades and even better looking. It’s cranked up to at least eleven.

New Story - Play through a brand new story set more than 20 years after Orcs Must Die! 2, where the War Mage and Sorceress have rebuilt the order and trained new young apprentices.

War Scenarios - All new War Scenarios deliver on the promise of massive scale first set out in Orcs Must Die! Confront overwhelming armies of orcs outside on the battlefields surrounding the castles. Thin out waves of orcs hundreds strong before they breach the walls and crash your rift.

War Machines - You’re going to need new weapons of death and destruction to handle these hordes. War Machines are traps on an oversized scale. Lay down your mega flip trap and launch dozens of ragdolling orcs. Mount your mega boom barrel launcher and unleash pyrotechnic glory.

It Never Stops - The legions of orcs keep coming long after the story is completed. Etch your name into the orc-slaying hall of fame through Weekly Challenges or see how long you can survive in Endless Mode.

Take Drastic Steps - Orcs Must Die! 3 comes with the Drastic Steps campaign and content for free, including terrifying flying enemies, heroic war guardians and of course more tools for orc destruction!

Scramble to Survive - The new Scramble Mode pits you against vile orcs who evolve with increasingly difficult and sinister tricks up their chunky sleeves. But each level you survive, you collect your own modifiers to fight back with!

reviews.review:
All Orcs Must Die games have been one of the best Tower Defense games made. Didn't seem like their heart was in OMD3 and seemed to be a fast cash game (maybe to support another game) that hasn't changed much since OMD2. It's a fun game for a few months at most, but the additional subject matter that was added to this game is lacking. I think most players noticed this after posting a good review, but didn't take the time to revise their review, because of the state of games today. If we had any other similar game options to compare, we would have noticed how little OMD3 has improved. 

Unchained had many issues, but this game seems to have a lot of the same and a few new issues. Adding more orcs on the screen at one time was nice (for a few maps) but most of the maps are small without much strategy or manipulating needed at all. Teamwork was much better in Unchained and I didn't feel like another game publisher was out to get more money than the game was worth. Seems the only thing this game did to make the maps "hard" was add more life and greatly increase the speed of the orcs. This made some of the smaller maps seem like the orcs were running faster than the heroes. Don't get me started on the lack of money we started with. Can't give us much money to buy traps when the maps are so small and boring. The 'good o' days' of gaming is lost with the must pay more for DLC (just to be a full game) or pay-to-win styles that have taken over.
Played lots of OMD1 and 2. 3 is a great successor and would def recommend as a great co op title.

Just as good as 1 and 2, and co-op is nice as always. Still hoping for a multiplayer that allows for more than 2 players. Feel like not a ton of new innovation among traps but no need to fix what aint broke I guess. Decent split between the trapping and over shoulder action play.
These orcs gotta die because it's funny

I enjoyed the first 2 OMDs, but didn't play the online one so its been awhile. I enjoyed this though can't see myself playing it as much as the first. Gameplay was fine and didn't experience any real bugs, so hey I enjoyed it for a bit. I did enjoy the big sieges as a change of pace too. I wish there were more maps however.

There are a lot of green guys here.
Very inclusive game, I recommend it.

applist.name: Call to Arms - Gates of Hell: Ostfront
applist.detailed_description:
Join our Discord


Just Updated


Call to Arms - Gates of Hell: Ostfront received a major update with new singleplayer missions, multiplayer maps, new units and much more for free! Learn more here!


About the Game

Call to Arms - Gates of Hell: Ostfront is a DLC for Call to Arms. It features the Eastern Front and its “Great Patriotic War” fought between the USSR and Germany. This RTS will take you from June 1941 until the end of the war in May 1945.




Call to Arms - Gates of Hell: Ostfront offers a choice of game modes including Singleplayer, dynamic campaign, PvE, PvP and co-op.
With its instantly switchable views, there’s something for every type of player. First person gunner views for all vehicles, third person views for vehicles and infantry, classic top-down direct control of a single unit or classic RTS top-down; they are all available and instantly switchable.




Conquest (dynamic campaign) mode offers singleplayer and co-op modes to play with your friends. Both modes allow you to compose your own army group, research new units and strategically advance in different paths to dominate the battlefield. The dynamic campaign can range from short to unlimited campaign lengths.



PvP/PvE offers a wide variety of maps from 1v1 to 4v4, and the use of “Doctrines”. These allow you to choose your own special units that fit your individual playstyle. The stage of the war (Early/Mid/Late) can be selected, to experience the evolution of equipment and vehicles as the conflict progressed.



Single player campaigns take place at historical locations, painstakingly recreated and immersive as hell.

Call to Arms - Gates of Hell: Ostfront offers:


  • 12 historical singleplayer missions that can also be played in co-op with friends.
  • 30 PvE and PvP maps
  • PvE Dynamic campaigns in which you develop your own army and fight an ever- changing war across a big collection of maps
  • PvP multiplayer offers doctrines to specialize your armies
  • Instantly switchable 3rd person/ direct control view mode for infantry
  • Instantly switchable 1st person/ 3rd person / direct control view mode for vehicles
  • Over 250 vehicles and 100 heavy weapons at your disposal
  • Air support mechanics and off-map artillery support
  • Realistically armored vehicles with accurate armor layouts, historical ammo loadouts and fully modeled internal components
  • The most realistic armor penetration and ammunition mechanics of any RTS out there
  • Land mines, magnetic mines, obstacle-laying, foxhole-building, bayonets, smokescreens, medics and countless other game mechanics
  • Authentic sound design and visuals
  • A full in- game editor plus modding/ workshop support

  • PvE Dynamic campaigns in which you develop your own army and fight an ever- changing war across a big collection of maps
  • PvP multiplayer offers doctrines to specialize your armies
  • Instantly switchable 3rd person/ direct control view mode for infantry
  • Instantly switchable 1st person/ 3rd person / direct control view mode for vehicles
  • Over 250 vehicles and 100 heavy weapons at your disposal
  • Air support mechanics and off-map artillery support
  • Realistically armored vehicles with accurate armor layouts, historical ammo loadouts and fully modeled internal components
  • The most realistic armor penetration and ammunition mechanics of any RTS out there
  • Land mines, magnetic mines, obstacle-laying, foxhole-building, bayonets, smokescreens, medics and countless other game mechanics
  • Authentic sound design and visuals
  • A full in- game editor plus modding/ workshop support
applist.short_description: Call to Arms - Gates of Hell is a realistic RTS/ RTT game that offers endless replay value. Command all types of troops in historical singleplayer, dynamic campaign, PvP and PvE battles. Are you ready for some serious immersion in World War 2?

content_descriptors.notes: Historical WWII depiction. Players will be exposed to mature and sensitive content. No body mutilation, or excessive use of gore.

reviews.review: Best WW2 RTS in the market at the moment :)
Very cool game, if only I had friends to play with ;-;

One of the best games I have ever played.

The immersion is insane. I have never played a ww2 game before that felt this chaotic. I can not recommend this game enough.

Not gone Lie about the game, Is Much Better than COH series and Men of war series. I can even....RP in this game as i expected but More, game is much worth it than other tactic games of any WW2 tactical games. But its my own Option, and Do not Judge my English Grammar.

I LOVE WW2 LARP!!!!!!


Very good RTS game. Easily worth the price and even more if bought on sale :D

Conquest cooperative. 

When you finish a level, don't exit the match. Loot the battlefield and repair everything like the goblin you are. Profit.

This game slaps. If you loved the core of Men of War: Assault Squad then you'll absolutely love how they've improved the formula here.

Hopefully the AI bugs are fixed in the future. I'll change my rating if they are.

Worth it for $20, but I wouldn't pay more if you're interested in Skirmish or Conquest. The AI cheats like crazy no matter the difficulty to the point I think it's broken.  It'll ignore the pop cap in Skirmish, so you'll get swarmed with half a dozen squads, multiple tanks, multiple vehicles, and artillery on standard settings, while you physically can't have even half that on your end. It seems to do the same thing in Conquest, from what I've seen.

It's a lot smarter than previous games at least. Your own unit AI is broken, though, worse than any game before this. Guys will just stand there getting shot and not return fire despite seeing the enemy, stand in place and jitter around when a grenade's thrown at them, and take the worst possible pathfinding routes when you move them.

Not tried the multiplayer yet, but on the PVE side, I'd call it unplayable in its current state.
Solid historical tactical RTS
This game kinda go hard, just like the MG42
Best Strategy games so far
COH 3 sucks so get this

Men of War Assault Squad 2, but better, by a lot, and with devs and a huge modding scene that're going to keep it alive for a long time. The campaign is challenging, the skirmish missions are excellent, the dynamic campaign is fun(if a bit lacking in depth currently, apparently the next update is adding some more depth there but it definitely could use some). 

Overall, best GEM-engine game(idek if this is GEM technically, but you understand the concept), solid 7.5-8/10, no better WW2 company/battalion RTS's currently out there being updated.
I love this game. The shooting to combat make every minute feel like it matters. Its one of the few games I can hop on every day with friends and have a new experience!
Its a little clunky, but in a good way. Fun RTS game, with very addicting gameplay.
Great game!  initially bit difficult to get used but then is very fun.... lots of units and there is many update and dlc!
one of the best ww2 strat games out
Incredibly unstable multiplayer, takes more time to set up a functioning game than you get to play.

This is the best successor to the Men of War franchise. I love the deep mechanical development and attention to detail the developers focus on. I hope to see continued cooperation with the modding community so that this game will have infinite re-playablity.

Performance upgrade my ass, its almost impossible to play multiplayer and conquest. It lags like crazy and doesn't load maps properly. New conquest change sucks too, sometimes it feels impossible to cap points because of the endless wave of machine guns and 75mm field guns that my 20mm auto cannon cant do anything to. Its not like i can send reinforcements anyway because i start with jackshit.

Overall the game looks good, sounds good and in the campaign plays very well (Except in Among the Heavens) but after the recent update, everything broke and i cant play the game anymore.
my fav ww2 rts i can play conquest mode for hours and never get bored of it lots of content and lots of replay value looking forward to more content updates both the dlcs are great too

applist.name: Friends vs Friends
applist.detailed_description:
Special Offer

https://store.steampowered.com/app/2432020/Friends_vs_Friends_Deluxe_Edition_Content/


About the Game



Play 1v1 or 2v2 in online, fast-paced, chaotic combat! Gain player levels, get new cards, improve the ones you already have, and get to know an array of eclectic characters with their own unique passive skills. The best part? At this price, you can invite all of your friends to get wrecked, guilt-free!


  • Friends vs Friends: Matchmake with players worldwide in 1v1 or 2v2 combat, or host private matches with your friends. Need Support? Invite your friends to spectate!
  • A Game with Character: Choose from a stylish cast of characters, each with their own abilities that improve the synergies of your deck.
  • Low Price + High Quality = How?!: In order to keep the crew together, we made sure to level the playing field on cost so jumping in is a big-brain move.
  • Progress to Impress: Level up and get new cards through matched bouts and timed challenges.
  • Stack Your Deck: Collect weapon, trap, and curse cards, then level them up to increase their power.
  • Updates and Seasonal Content: Expect post-launch content including new unique characters, cards, maps, and upgrades to your home base.
  • Play Dress-up: Unlock cool cosmetics like skins and card design variants for bragging rights!
  • Practice, Practice, Practice: Go up against bots to try out new card combos and improve your skills for when it counts.



 
🎵 Let me tell you ‘bout some friends who invested all they had in a shady site that looked like a scam 🎵

reviews.review: Great game, a ton of fun to play with friends, my only complaint is that quest progress is disabled when playing private matches and 1v1s against someone in your party, so people who just want to play with their friends are effectively punished with a slower rate of progression, which doesn't really fit the vibe of a game called friends vs friends

Play with friend, life good.  Friend fight back, KILL friend.  Friend gone.   Think about friend.


Regret.

With over 85 hours played from the Beta this is a must buy game. it's Really fun and really cheap for a game that has overwhelming support from the community, fun characters, Great Deck Building with multiple ways to play, And ZERO P2W stuff that the devs confirmed about. The devs are very active and play the game as well to interact with there community. If you have any spare money laying around this is a must get game with lots of potential.
reviews.developer_response: Thanks so much for the review - looking forward to getting you even more content soon, Friend!

reviews.review: I have no friends
I promise i am not a furry

Rarely do i write reviews, but some wrong info in these reviews makes me feel obligated to.

Friends Vs Friends is a 1v1 or 2v2 Fast Paced Deck Building FPS. Think Furry Quake if your opponent can activate vampire poison bullets on a katana while moving 40% faster. You buy packs with in game currency to get new cards and upgrade your current ones, and some of these get quite unique. Head exposure reveals an enemy brain above the rivals head for 4 seconds that amps damage 10x, which can be countered by cards like tin man that turns you and your ally invincible for temporarily while slowing you. It's a really interesting system that opens the door for many different playstyles and decks.

The maps are all fun despite there only being 4 of them right now, each giving a different range of engagement and lending itself to certain decks and characters better than others. Trucks is a compact map with moving parts and deadly falls into the road that makes movement speed and close range more important than trying to keep distance, where rooftops is 2 roofs that make both long range play and rush strats viable. The characters are much the same way, each giving a massive influence over how you build your deck, such as explosive resistance, starting with a Brasshopper smg, double jumps, ect.

To clear up misinfo, no you cannot buy cards with real money. There are no microtransactions in this game. The deluxe edition gives no card packs, just access to upcoming expansions.

Yes, you can 2v2 with a friend against random. Just open your ui menu, and there's an invite button on the top right. When they join, hit 2v2. You are now playing Friends Vs Friends with your friends.

Some actual issues with the game right now is the progression, but as of right now they came out with a patch that "fixes" progression that I have not played. An issue that is here is explosives clipping your camera into the floor or walls from the flinch. This happens to enemies too, particularly to moose for some reason, making it really disorienting when a bomb goes off. I've heard of it happening with being hit by a sniper but I haven't had this.

All in all, wonderful game. If you have friends, queue up 2v2 and work together with your decks and you'll curb stomp in no time.

The game is amazing but one problem I've already ran into is the cheaters. With in the first 2 hrs of playing someone was hitting every head shot so I did my research to look if theirs hacks for this game and first 10mins found it https://www.aimjunkies.com/cheats-mods-aimbot/friends-vs-friends i hope they add anticheat and not easyanticheat please that shit is trash.
there's a crocodile and i can play as them

Look I can tell a lot of love went into this game and it has a great original idea but honestly it just doesn't work. I give it a lot of credit for not being pay to win and having a lot of personality but game play wise a lot of stuff needs to be fixed or outright scrapped to save this games life.

 First off and this is the most important point is that its entirely hostile to new players and its not even an issue of skill here, the problem lies in the cards leveling system. New players get base cards with no levels putting them at a huge disadvantage against the sweats and veteran players which will kill your player base post launch. This is the same issue battlefront had with its cards because its a no fun zone for people just trying to get ahead of the curve. 

Second is the leveling and how its a grind to get new character unlocks. Getting tokens and card packs is a major grind and takes forever to get a hold of. At level 10 with 7 hours so far I have bought like 3 gold card packs. I mean there's nothing else to spend your money on and since the game just started I understand, just hoping its temporary until the game gets more content. Also that weird gumball machine thing for cosmetics, like getting tokens for that is near impossible since you need 3 and only get like 1 token for completing daily tasks that are a whole other grind fest for new players. 

The characters are cool and unique but giving them special cards that are just like free op weapons isnt a good idea. I think that the characters who get free weapons at the start should either have a nerfed version of the gun or just scarp giving people weapons unless its in a card. Like use Duck Anderson as a model for this because Im tired of these guys who get to start off with smgs and katanas who build decks based around getting up in your face and having do defense against them. Like close quarters guns dominate this game and I would like to see some balance changes in the future.

TLDR: Game is pretty but game play needs a heavy overhaul. New players get no love. Hope to see major changes.

Well crafted ! not my cup of tea but good anyway,
younger gamers than me will probably appreciate it more.
Solo players can use matchmaking no problem, 
but it would be better with friends
and even after my refund, i still recommend it ^_^
Have Fun PPL

I want to love this game. I really really do. But as it is right now the matchmaking is incredibly unbalanced and the progression is very grindy, even after their recent adjustment. The style of this game is great and I love the idea of the gameplay, but it needs some work for it to be fair and for the progression to feel rewarding rather than feeling like a chore.

You can give [b][i]Big Head[/i][/b] to your friends in this game!

[h1][b]10 / 10[/b][/h1]

DJ Newton <3
My Beloved
10 Reasons why DJ Newton is cooler than u:
• They have better aim. (ok you just suck)
• They have cooler starting clothes.
• They have a wizard skin. (you don't)
• They have circle glasses. (you might not)
• They are a crocodile?! (that is true, no they are not an alligator)
• They are a DJ?!
• They have the BEST voice-lines. (you cannot convince me otherwise)
• They shoot their friends?! (I hope you don't)
• They love their friends.
• They are just cooler ok? (couldn't think of any more ;-;)
This game is pretty much ROUNDS but it's FPS. 10/10
Fun game to play, even funnier with friends
furry game of the year

The cards system and voxel graphics bring a unique spin to the arena shooter genre. Game runs fantastic and has a 100+ FOV slider. Weekly updates means lots of new content to look forward to. 

Balancing needs some work, some cards when used together can almost decide the fight before it starts. Only four maps means the matches can feel a little repetitive.

tldr: A must try for all FPS enjoyers, and an absolute steal at $5.99.

[h1] An incredible Gem with Devs Who Listen [/h1]

Not a day after the game is out and complaints heard by amazing devs have seen the progression system generously tweaked. A patch this morning at lightning speed took the progression from glacial to reasonable in one fell swoop. This feels like a much better place for the game and I'm much happier with how it is to get cards and xp now. That being my biggest complaint there really isn't a reason to ignore this one if you're at all looking for a quirky shooter that has been carefully crafted with love. I'd still like to see quests at least tweaked to "play" based objectives instead of win. As to the developers comment about friends helping friends complete quests. Personally I don't see such a problem with that. Daily quests get us to log in. If the game is fun enough we'll play anyway (and this one certainly is). 

In addition to the very helpful changes to xp and cash gain they even added level based matchmaking that tries to match you near your current player level. It's not MMR but absolutely fixes the issue I had with some players already using level 4 versions of cards. 

The remaining complaints are minor enough and if this first patch is anything to go off of will likely be fixed and probably are already seen. I still think the cosmetic coins are stingy and would still think they were a bit stingy if we got 1 every game. Quests should absolutely be available sooner than level 8 and need that switch from "win" to "play" but these are minor problems.

This game is incredibly generous. My previous bellyaching was really an ache for a game with so much promise and joy to give me a yet smoother experience. The truth is for the cost of a cheap lunch I've already spent hours laughing and smiling with my friends and that's absolutely worth it. This game is a gift and the price is a steal and if you're at all on the edge here please let me push you over it and while you're diving in, grab your friends too.

Now if only there were some mini games to play in this diner.

[b](OLD REVIEW LEFT BELOW FOR COMPARISON)[/b]

This game has charm, it's got ritz, the guns sound right, the music is lovely, the animation when you open the game is exciting, catchy and fun! They even have a hub to mess around in while you wait to find a match. Interesting level design, Unique core concept and what is probably one of the worst progression systems I've seen in a non free to play game. Mind you there are no microtransactions but honestly I've seen games that squeeze you for gold or gems that are more generous.

After 8 hours of play I managed a total of 10 levels and half of them didn't get me anything. Packs cost way too much and your xp and cash you gain takes forever. Quests usually want you to win and you don't even get them until level 8. When you do get quests they ask you to do absurdly long tasks. "win 8 1v1 games" w h a t?! With the average win rate being 50% that's like asking me to play 16 games. Except its not because theres no MMR so if you struggle with the game at all you'll never be completing these quests. Go on a losing streak? Get ready to feel it. Worst of all about the current quest system is that [b] in a game literally titled "Friends vs Friends" you cannot complete quests against your friends. You are punished for fighting your friends.[/b]

Cosmetics are in this game and accessable with in game earned currency. That's kinda cool! Except to get them you need to do ALL 3 of your daily quests and that gets you 1 token of 3 that you need to put into a literal gacha machine to get a chance for 1 cosmetic. Did you get a bad one? Don't worry after another 24 actual hours of gameplay you might have your next one. Here's hoping you get something besides a profile picture for the following roll!

This would all be fine but the guy who's been playing since the beta has a lv 4 gun and 3 cards you've never seen before and will absolutely delete you the second you walk out with your "big head mode" card you just played. This is a masterful and amazingly well made game that's so close to where I want it to be. I'll change this review when I see an update made to address the absolutely painful progression.

The developers claim they'll change this soon. When they do I'll change this review.
reviews.developer_response:
Hey! 

We have patched the game with a faster progression and also a better matchmaking system that look for players with the same level (or near to that) which means the same amount of cards or card's level.

About the progression we are tunning it, the last patch set it a bit more faster so we will be tweaking during these first days.

Regarding to completing quest with friends we had that back in the time and people used it to exploit the game. But we are looking for options because i feel similar to you about this,

Thanks for the feedback! <3

reviews.review: The matchmaking is busted every match i play is with someone double my rank who stomps me with ak. Makes it a grind to progress when the level based matchmaking doesnt work

applist.name: SOMA
applist.detailed_description:
Frictional Games

https://store.steampowered.com/app/1944430/Amnesia_The_Bunker/


About the Game

SOMA is a sci-fi horror game from Frictional Games, the creators of Amnesia: The Dark Descent. It is an unsettling story about identity, consciousness, and what it means to be human.

The radio is dead, food is running out, and the machines have started to think they are people. Underwater facility PATHOS-II has suffered an intolerable isolation and we’re going to have to make some tough decisions. What can be done? What makes sense? What is left to fight for?

Enter the world of SOMA and face horrors buried deep beneath the ocean waves. Delve through locked terminals and secret documents to uncover the truth behind the chaos. Seek out the last remaining inhabitants and take part in the events that will ultimately shape the fate of the station. But be careful, danger lurks in every corner: corrupted humans, twisted creatures, insane robots, and even an inscrutable omnipresent A.I.
You will need to figure out how to deal with each one of them. Just remember there’s no fighting back, either you outsmart your enemies or you get ready to run.

If you want an existential crisis, play this game. Some great philosophical concepts to ponder.

I recommend playing it on the story setting where the enemies can't really hurt you for a more in depth experience. The stress and rush from the normal setting isn't worth missing out on exploring the map and experiencing all of the lore.
Played for scares, left with an existential crisis.

The story of SOMA is about some interesting topics, someday in the future human will eventually be able to copy brain as neurograph and plant it in somebody else or machine. Then what is my self? And what is human and what's not?
I reckon my self is not my body but my consciousness or my soul, Sarang figured our conscious mind is not the pattern of our brain, but a continuous emergent entity based on that pattern, a continuous flow of thought and perception keeps an unbroken chain of continuity that we know as our self.
Furthermore, walking corpse, artificial intelligence like more intelligent than WAU, computer with a cortex chip containing someone's brain scan like Catherine, which can be called human? Or neither?

Story's not the only reason I love this game, there's also epic horrific atmosphere and great xeno-fauna and deep-sea graphics.
My favorite horror game so far.

Existential Crisis.

I do recomended to play this without knowing anything
Catherine? Please don't leave me alone. Catherine -- Catherine?!

I came into this game expecting an (okay) single player game but GOD was i wrong, Phenomenal graphics and world-building make you almost lose touch with reality and the voice acting is genuinely outstanding even compared to Modern Triple A games. The story didn't interest me much for the first hour but i quickly got invested the more I listened to Recordings, Notes, and Emails left behind. As many times this game made my heart ache, it shattered my expectations. 

10/10, Top 10 games i've ever played by far.
Great overall story. One of the best horror games I've ever played.

This is a very good game. The story is compelling and getting more interesting as the game progresses. The horror elements are very well done and will keep you at the edge of your seat. Although I don't think it's one of the best psychological horror games of all time. During my first playthrough, I've encountered so much flaws within the game. However, I still enjoyed it.

[h1] The Bad [/h1]
⌧ There is no option to load your game directly from the pause menu. So you will have to spend your time to go back to the main menu to load another save.
⌧ Some of the enemies can detect the player by proximity without even having to see the player's character model. On top of that, the game doesn't give you enough resource to detect the enemies' positions.
⌧ Once you get detected and attacked by an enemy, they won't kill you off right away. You will have another chance before you get detected and attacked again until your health (which the game doesn't show) runs out, also you move a lot slower during that period.
⌧ The lack of minimap/map is a problem. Even in a linear horror game, being able to see the map is always a big help to navigate through a new area and know where your character wants to go.
⌧ Too many dead ends in some parts of the maps. This can be frustrating if you've spent a lot of time to get past an enemy in a huge area, and then end up nowhere.
⌧ The head wobble effect can't be turned off. If you are a motion sickness-sensitive person like me, consider yourself be warned before playing this game.
⌧ The game still has a lot of game-breaking bugs which can cause you to get stuck and forces you to reload a save.

[h1] The Good [/h1]
⌧ Interesting and very well written story.
⌧ Phenomenal horror atmosphere.
⌧ The sound design is very good. Playing with a headset is highly recommended.
⌧ Very good score and music.
⌧ Very simple gameplay mechanics.

[h1] Verdict [/h1]
So, is this a good game? Of course it is. Do I recommend it? Yes. But is it a perfect game as most people say? No, it's just a good horror game. I recommend you to get this game on sale, but if you decided to grab this game at the full price, it's not a bad idea either. This is a solid 8/10 game, nothing more.

SOMA is one of the best games I've ever played. Deeply existential and dripping with atmosphere. A must play for anyone who questions the nature of their humanity (which is everyone).

If horror games aren't your thing, throw it in safe mode and play it anyway. You owe it to yourself.
One of the best games ever made
Be prepared to confront your deepest fears and question the very essence of your existence.
if u want tension, just take it don't look back.

"Please don't leave me alone". 

Man, this game has got to be one of the best games ever. It really makes you ask what it means to be human and the ending leaves you godsmacked. And to top it off the voice acting is so freakin'fantastic it's criminal. The second level's graphics are absolutely terrible, so be prepared for that, but that won't take long.

Also look up the Cut Ending Dialogue: it's a neat little extra after you finish the game.
The best Sci-Fi that humanity ever produced

Best walking simulator I have played yet.
Will keep you at the edge of your seat while playing and at the edge of your mind right after.
10/10 would SOMA again.

I bought this game back in 2016 but only played for like, an hour before getting bored and leaving it untouched for basically 7 years (though I did try to play it again once in between that time, but again, with basically no progress). Now that I finally finished it, I felt like leaving a review. It deserves that much. Also, it's everything that piece of shit "game" called Scorn tried to be lol.

SOMA's more of an interactive story than it is a "game"; in the way of gameplay, it's basically a walking simulator. You get to solve some puzzles here and there and look for items to progress, and you'll also go through some horror chase and hide-and-seek portions throughout your journey too. Those sequences are actually pretty intense and thrilling since the game makes a VERY good use of sound design to make you feel like the monster(s) are literally breathing down your neck.

Atmosphere is also another thing SOMA gets down well. The underwater, derelict environment really makes you feel alone and conveys the feeling of claustrophobia, despair, and finality that its former workers felt during their final moments. 

The best part, though, is obviously the story, which is really what made me stick with the game once I decided to try it out again. It's a bit of a slow start even once you end up on Pathos-II, but once the mystery of what really happened to you and your world really rears its head, it's easy to get hooked and keep playing to uncover more. It's a tragic tale that ends on a rather ambiguous and, to me, unsatisfying note, but that's kind of the point given the existential themes the story explores. Even if you don't agree with the way the mind, and I guess soul, is conceptualized, the story is still worth a playthrough.

The only bad thing I have to say about the game is that your choices don't really matter to the story. "Choices" are more there for *you* the player to think about, but there's only one ending, and your progress and interactions don't really change (to my knowledge) apart from some minor dialogue changes every so often.

Story was decent enough, voice acting was good and the "look" was nice and clean (not at all demanding on the GPU) but much of game play was simply annoying, especially many of the mouse gesture mechanics used to interact with objects. I was interested but only bought because of the Safe Mode patch; I'm sure I'd have found it even more annoying without that. I might have felt I got my money's worth at $15 but $30 for a rather meh game was a little pricey, especially as it has no replay value.
I see you can't leave a review without also adding a yes or no recommendation so I'll say yes, with the proviso "if you like vaguely creepy/survival horror/puzzle games, you might like this".

I thought I already posted a review about this game but it seems to have gone.

Playing SOMA was my favorite gaming experience I have ever had. I would argue it is the best example of a game as a storytelling device. 
I will rant about forever about how I believe this game shows that games can be a narrative, atmospheric and life changing experience on par with any book or movie.

You will finish the game, and you will sit there and stare at the credits. You will close it maybe, or you will go back to the main menu and just sit there. 
I will think about the game for the rest of my life. Same way you do when you finish a an amazing movie or book.

It is phenomenal, and I hope Frictional can one day create something that rivals this game in terms of storytelling. But SOMA will still stand alone with it's unique experience.

2 / 2

SOMA is an exceptional game that deserves high acclaim for its thought-provoking narrative, immersive atmosphere, and innovative gameplay. Developed by Frictional Games, the same studio behind the renowned Amnesia series, SOMA delivers a truly unforgettable experience.

One of the standout features of SOMA is its deeply engaging story. The game delves into profound existential questions about consciousness, identity, and the nature of humanity. Through its well-crafted dialogues and immersive storytelling, SOMA prompts players to contemplate the ethical and philosophical implications of advanced technology and artificial intelligence. The narrative twists and turns, keeping players on the edge of their seats and leaving a lasting impact long after the game is over. 10/10

applist.name: Aliens: Fireteam Elite
applist.detailed_description:
EDITIONS


INTO THE HIVE EDITION


Venture into the hive and experience the Aliens: Fireteam Elite story! The Into the Hive Edition includes both the Standard Edition of the game and its Pathogen expansion, which adds a new campaign with three new missions on top of the twelve missions already included in the base game.

THE ULTIMATE EDITION


The Ultimate Edition of Aliens: Fireteam Elite is a must have for any aspiring Colonial Marine. Upgrading from the Standard Edition gets you the Pathogen expansion, complete with a new campaign, new weapons and more! Plus, the Ultimate Edition also includes the full suite of Endeavor Pass cosmetic DLCs and the Endeavor Veteran Pack.


About the Game

https://store.steampowered.com/app/1942650/

Play with up to two players or AI as you battle through four campaigns to explore the mystery of a new planet, LV-895. Discover what hides in the ruins and caves beneath in this third-person survival shooter set in the Aliens universe.


Build your fireteam focusing on class composition, consumables, and weapons to take down Xenomorphs, beat Challenge Card runs, or play various game modes with friends.


Blast through hordes of Xenomorphs, evade deadly Prowlers and Spitters, and set up defensive positions to stay alive long enough to get your fireteam to safety.


Build your Marine the way you want. Level up in each of 7 unique classes or be a master of one. Choose your weapon – everything from magnums and SMGs to rocket launchers – and use over 130 unique perks to create the build of your choice.


Level your character through 7 Class Kits, each with two unique abilities to use in combat and unlockable perks. Max out a variety of weapons, powering them up in stats the more you use them.

reviews.review:
I'm torn on this one because I did have fun playing it, but I've got to give it a thumbs down. It just misses the mark too much, is too uninspired, and is so resoundingly [i]meh.[/i]

I enjoy the [i]Alien[/i] franchise and primarily play co-op games these days, so I figured [i]A:FE[/i] would be a perfect fit. And don't get me wrong, the action is certainly there. It's just that that's pretty much all there is. Every new room, a wave of xenomorphs. Trigger a scripted sequence, a wave of xenomorphs. Take ten steps, a wave of xenomorphs.

There's precisely none of the suspense of the films. It really is just run and gun. Maybe that's the best you can manage in a game of this type, but if you're expecting the tension and fear of [i]Alien: Isolation[/i] you'll be disappointed.

Add in some frustrating scripting and design flaws, occasionally stupid writing (seriously, just [i]nuke the site from orbit[/i]), and questionable progression (I used the same gear for the whole game), and you've got an overall fairly bland experience. Plus the fact that the story never really felt like it took off and was entirely over around the time I was expecting act two. Even the Pathogen Expansion DLC didn't really add much.

But as with all things, cost is a factor. Having been bundled, you can now get [i]A:FE[/i] for just a few dollars and at that price it's a worthwhile distraction for the ~13 hours we put into it. It's just not a [i]good[/i] game.

If you are a fan of the Aliens universe and want to fight xenomorphs as a Colonial Marine? 

Then this third-person shooter might be for you. It has its own music score that does not detract from the atmosphere of threat and ambush. Up to three players can form a Fireteam in cross-platform multiplayer. The game has an elementary story not directly connected to the theatrical - but the game will give you a sense of being a part of the Aliens universe. 

Aliens FTE does have some faults, even after several patches. But an approach with a "glass is half-full" attitude and it can be enjoyed. With different Marine classes and skill-sets, players can find a style suitable. 

So, Lock and Load those Pulse Rifles and watch your motion detectors. They do come out of the damn walls.

Nothing much not to like here. Just a solid, 1-3 player, co-op experience with 12 built-in maps, with slight procedural variations each time, and each maybe 20-40 mins long the first time you play them. Also a bunch of classes, some not-too-grindy unlocks of varied weapons and perks/buffs and a store for some pretty basic cosmetics. There's even a little bit of lore to pick up along the way when you interact with NPCs back on the lobby ship. Some great VA by the principle cast too.
2nd best extraterrestrial genocide game right behind Deep Rock Galactic.
A average game and a fun one, just built poorly on a bad engine.  A fair win.  Get it on sale for at least 50% off
Fun team based game! Kill Kill Kill Demolisher is pretty OP!

Bought this specifically to play with friends. Seems to be a huge problem for many players without any help!
Good luck with that ... will not look at any of your titles again.

Good balance of challenge and fun. Hoping for another DLC eventually, but the game is long enough anyway. Satisfying leveling system. Interesting collectible card modifyers for missions. Rare to find a polished Co-op shooter like this. I would check it out.
if you loved watching the movie in 1986, and wanted to be there with Hicks and Hudson, then this is the game for you! great game play and very difficult, it will challenge the best gamers out there.
Very good game with friends

I watched the developers play it during development, and still I did not pre-order AFE.
I watched other people play it after release, and still I did not buy AFE.
I watched cosmetics DLCs appear, and still I did not buy AFE.
I watched the Pathogen DLC appear, and still I did not buy AFE.

Then...with money left on a Steam gift card after buying A Plague Tale: Requiem, something happened. “Where’s the goddamn beacon? Oh. I see it." I finally bought AFE.

I wish I had not waited. “It was a bad call, Ripley. A bad call…” The game is tremendous fun, solo or with co-operative players. 

INCOMING COMMUNICATION FROM MUTHR: "You must enjoy games where you continually play through levels to improve your skills, earn attachments/weapons/cosmetics/etc. because otherwise you might find it a grind after finishing the narrative missions. All other considerations secondary. Crew expendable."

Fun game, but the connection issue are some of the worse in the gaming industry, you waste more time trying to play with friends then playing the game, this isn't a rare occurrence with the game sadly either, further into the missions it seems the connection with peer 2 peer just becomes unbearable, such a shame really

Aliens: Fireteam Elite - A Thrilling Extraterrestrial Adventure
BOTTOM LINE - A must play super fun game that recreates the atmosphere of the Aliens genre almost perfectly.  

Aliens: Fireteam Elite is an absolute gem of a game that takes the iconic Alien franchise to new heights of excitement and intensity. Developed by Cold Iron Studios, this PC game delivers an exhilarating co-op experience that will keep you on the edge of your seat from start to finish. Get ready to unleash your inner space marine and embark on an unforgettable journey battling relentless xenomorphs!

From the moment you step into the boots of a Colonial Marine, Aliens: Fireteam Elite thrusts you into an immersive world filled with heart-pounding action and nail-biting suspense. The attention to detail is astounding, with stunning visuals that bring the dark and eerie atmosphere of the Alien universe to life. Every corridor, every flickering light, and every encounter with the horrifying creatures feels authentic, creating an atmosphere that will send shivers down your spine.

The gameplay is where Aliens: Fireteam Elite truly shines. Whether playing solo with AI teammates or teaming up with friends in co-op mode, the game offers a seamless and satisfying experience. The combat mechanics are fluid and responsive, allowing for intense firefights against waves of xenomorphs. With a wide array of weapons, gear, and character classes to choose from, each playthrough feels fresh and exciting.

Aliens: Fireteam Elite boasts a rich progression system that rewards players with unlockable abilities, weapons, and customization options. This provides a sense of accomplishment and encourages replayability, as you strive to perfect your loadout and tackle higher difficulty levels. The inclusion of challenge cards adds an extra layer of variety, allowing you to modify missions and create unique gameplay experiences.

The sound design is exceptional, with a hauntingly atmospheric soundtrack and eerie ambient sounds that amplify the tension and horror. The voice acting is top-notch, capturing the essence of the Alien franchise and adding an extra layer of immersion to the gameplay.

In summary, Aliens: Fireteam Elite is a must-play for fans of the Alien franchise and anyone seeking an adrenaline-fueled cooperative shooting experience. With its captivating visuals, intense gameplay, and meticulous attention to detail, it stands as a testament to the dedication and passion of the developers at Cold Iron Studios. Prepare for an unforgettable journey into the dark and dangerous depths of space, where only the bravest survive. Get ready to face the xenomorph threat head-on in Aliens: Fireteam Elite!
Fun game with good progression and weapon customization. Better with friends, especially at higher levels.

The disconnect from multiplayer session and inability to rejoin is game breaking.
You lose 40+ minutes of progress and rewards and it costs you loot cards.

I can't recommend this game with this terrible bug. It made me stop playing and it was such a awesome game.

While some things are annoying like navigating menus, actually playing the game is fun.

Shooting aliens is a good time, classes with simple progression. I'm not a massive fan of crazy progression in arcade-ish shooters, but this is simple and fun. Playing a tetras style game to choose perks and fit them on a board.
Playing with mostly bots it;s not team game enymorte

first son bought it - played it - loved it -moved on..... I the father buy it over a year later to play with second son -loved it- brought first son back to play again with us so it must be pretty good to bring a 9 year old a 26 year old and a 51 year old together to play a game when they have very different schedules and lives you read into that what you want but either way for a 40 quid outlay (two copies) feels like a good buy and a very tidy game if your an aliens fan and love FPS this will cheer you up on a cold night but its my strong recommendation to co-op it with peeps ya like

Absurd underrated Horde Shooter game.

[b]+[/b]
[list]
    [*]Great Aliens vibe and great style mixture of the classic Aliens tetralogy and the newer Prometheus background saga
    [*]Good graphics, good optimization and authentic sound design
    [*]Lots of character customization options
    [*]High tactical depth due to many perk and weapon loadout options
[/list]

[b]-[/b]
[list]
    [*]Limited replayability for lack of mission and game mode content
    [*]No ingame text/voice chat
    [*]I experienced some random crashes but this might be an individual issue
    [*]Can be grindy at times
[/list]

If you're into Horde Shooters and the Alien franchise in particular, this one is a no-brainer.

[h1] More of a USCM dress up sim than a game[/h1] 
[b]I mean its ok but its a low OK if that makes sense sale price yeah sure full price no[/b] 

i love the alien franchise i love the colonial marines and their over the top bravado i love the designs of H.R Geiger sadly i do not love this game as much as i want to there is just nothing to it. Little to no atmosphere the combat feels stale and parts turn into a cover shooter with really bad AI, granted they are WY synths so i guess that could be an excuse for why the AI feels like its from the late 2000's.  That however does not excuse the rest of the combat which is small encounters of enemies running right at you followed by the mandated hold this area as enemies try to swarm which should be fun it should feel like every time this happens its the last stand its about to be game over man as aliens who want some come at you from all angles but...nope they don't send enough to actually swarm and its done from such a distance that there feels like there is no actual threat. i mean perhaps it gets better towards the end but it felt like a slog to get the where i was and was rather exhausting telling myself i am having fun.

applist.name: Lobotomy Corporation | Monster Management Simulation
applist.detailed_description:
Monsters beyond your imagination, and you: The Manager.

Monsters beyond your imagination, and you: The Manager. Monsters beyond your imagination, and you: The Manager. A roguelite monster-management simulation inspired by the likes of the SCP Foundation, Cabin in the Woods, and Warehouse 13. Order your employees to perform work with the creatures and watch as it unfolds; harness greater energy, and expand the facility. One disaster will lead to another, until everything has fallen into chaos. “I give you a warm welcome to Lobotomy Corporation.”

Lobotomy Corporation is a roguelite monster-management simulation.

Our game was inspired by the monsters birthed of various inspirations featured in games, film, and series, such as the SCP Foundation, Cabin in the Woods, and Warehouse 13. Going further, it was developed with this thought: “What if those monsters were real, and your job were to manage them?”

You will be playing as the Manager of Lobotomy Corporation, a company in which such creatures are contained and managed. Order your employees to perform work with and on the creatures and watch the results expectantly. Gather energy produced by the monsters and fulfill the quota each day, expand the facility, and manage even more strange beings. In this game, the player will face an ever-present sense of tension and dread as they progress through each day.


“Our new technology will bring salvation to humanity.”



Lobotomy Corporation is a newly established energy company that isolates Abnormalities and extracts an infinite amount of energy from them by using independently developed technology, or so it seems on the outside. Join the corporation, and witness the true reality with your own eyes.

Lobotomy Corp. consists of several departments, much like any other company. You will have access to various departments as you harness more energy. The more departments you have unlocked, the more efficient the management of Abnormalities will become.

Furthermore, AIs such as Angela and the ‘Sephirot’ will be at your side to provide all the assistance you need for smooth progression.


Beings that you must constantly research and observe.



We dubbed the creatures that reside in Lobotomy Corporation, ‘Abnormalities’.

You will have to try your best to keep your employees out of danger while extracting as much energy as possible from the Abnormalities. However, you must learn what types of work you should and shouldn’t perform via trial and error.

You start with zero information on the Abnormalities. At first, your eyes, ears, and the in-game manual will be your only hints. Let your intuition pick the work type that might suit the Abnormality best. After that, order the employee who is best suited for the job to work on the Abnormality, and wait for the results. In the process of managing Abnormalities, you will gain the power of information.

The amount of energy you can acquire from Abnormalities will depend heavily on the type of work your employees perform.


This is NOT a tycoon.



As mentioned before, Abnormalities are beings that need to be treated with great care. Some might dislike the idea of being locked inside a Containment Unit, and may sometimes attempt to breach containment.

A breaching Abnormality will attack every employee in sight and disrupt the facility’s systems. Worse still, it could open up other units and cause more Abnormalities to escape. Furthermore, employees eroded or corrupted by certain Abnormalities will have a greatly adverse influence on other employees. Employees brainwashed by Abnormalities might randomly attack those around them, wholly oblivious to what they are doing. In addition, employees may go insane from serious psychic trauma, disobeying your orders and damaging the psyche of other employees around them.


One disaster leads to another, until everything has fallen into chaos.



If you fail to resolve a situation immediately, it will ultimately spiral out of control and throw the whole facility into chaos. When such a situation does occur, you will have to gather employees to suppress any threat and regain control of the situation, or give up parts of the facility to ensure the company’s safety.


“Tell me, manager. Do you have any wishes?”



The game consists of two main portions: Monster Management and visual Story Segments.
Once a day of managing Abnormalities and producing energy ends, the story segment will follow right afterward.

In the Story Segments, dialogue with Angela (the AI you’ll also be seeing occasionally in the management portion of the game) and the Sephirot will play. As you progress through the missions they give, you will come closer to the truth hidden deep in the company. You may have to ask questions, or answer questions from others. Here, you will uncover the secrets surrounding the company and yourself, and mayhaps even more.

“Hello, X.”
“I give you a warm welcome to Lobotomy Corporation.”

Beings that you must constantly research and observe.



We dubbed the creatures that reside in Lobotomy Corporation, ‘Abnormalities’.

You will have to try your best to keep your employees out of danger while extracting as much energy as possible from the Abnormalities. However, you must learn what types of work you should and shouldn’t perform via trial and error.

You start with zero information on the Abnormalities. At first, your eyes, ears, and the in-game manual will be your only hints. Let your intuition pick the work type that might suit the Abnormality best. After that, order the employee who is best suited for the job to work on the Abnormality, and wait for the results. In the process of managing Abnormalities, you will gain the power of information.

The amount of energy you can acquire from Abnormalities will depend heavily on the type of work your employees perform.


This is NOT a tycoon.



As mentioned before, Abnormalities are beings that need to be treated with great care. Some might dislike the idea of being locked inside a Containment Unit, and may sometimes attempt to breach containment.

A breaching Abnormality will attack every employee in sight and disrupt the facility’s systems. Worse still, it could open up other units and cause more Abnormalities to escape. Furthermore, employees eroded or corrupted by certain Abnormalities will have a greatly adverse influence on other employees. Employees brainwashed by Abnormalities might randomly attack those around them, wholly oblivious to what they are doing. In addition, employees may go insane from serious psychic trauma, disobeying your orders and damaging the psyche of other employees around them.


One disaster leads to another, until everything has fallen into chaos.



If you fail to resolve a situation immediately, it will ultimately spiral out of control and throw the whole facility into chaos. When such a situation does occur, you will have to gather employees to suppress any threat and regain control of the situation, or give up parts of the facility to ensure the company’s safety.


“Tell me, manager. Do you have any wishes?”



The game consists of two main portions: Monster Management and visual Story Segments.
Once a day of managing Abnormalities and producing energy ends, the story segment will follow right afterward.

In the Story Segments, dialogue with Angela (the AI you’ll also be seeing occasionally in the management portion of the game) and the Sephirot will play. As you progress through the missions they give, you will come closer to the truth hidden deep in the company. You may have to ask questions, or answer questions from others. Here, you will uncover the secrets surrounding the company and yourself, and mayhaps even more.

“Hello, X.”
“I give you a warm welcome to Lobotomy Corporation.”

God, Project moon really has a way of making you play 3 games, read 2 novels, and hate your life just to understand the story.
Being a manager means suffering

Whether or not you'd enjoy this game hinges on actually getting over the fact that you need to trial and error your way to victory at times. I think I sunk way too much time into trying to keep basically everyone alive despite the fact that actively hindered my learning process early on, but still I'd say that I had a lot of fun spending that time figuring out how to manage each abnormality and deal with each and every ordeal (I don't think I would do it again though).

Day 1: Religion.
Day 12: [REDACTED] is cute!
Day 24: I take that back.
Day 29: There's nothing there to worry about.
Day 36: Legs Undertale?
Day 44: I am no longer a god.
Day 49: Am I having a heart attack?
Day 50: *Flips Table*

I'm going to put this out front, if you don't like grindy/monotonous games, don't get this game. The 'retry day' button will be your best and closest friend right next to 'memory repository.' If you don't grind for the gear, the levels, and to complete missions, you're going to have a rough time. 

Most of the tutorial is 'do this and only this' but it's good for people who don't have a clue as to what they're doing. All the extra information can be found in the manual, alongside some sweet sweet lore. Such as the reason the clerks carry a handgun, of which they're told is for self defense, but they'll learn it's use "when the time comes." (;  However, I encourage those who have friends who have played the game before teach them the basics outside of the tutorial levels. I have taught some new players over Discord, it's time efficient, and less confusing.

The story is, in my opinion, the best part of this game. They have explanations for nearly everything, including why everything looks cute and cartoony. The characters and their development is fantastic and satisfying as they talk about their backstory and you learn about their personalities. The fact that most of the Abnormalities and the story itself is based off of various books and literature.

Unbeknownst to many, this game is for those who enjoy improvement through failure, and the roller coaster of emotions that comes with. And trust me, I mean it when I say that. One day in the game will be peaceful, no Abnormality breaches, no Agent deaths, and man, you got all the easy Ordeals! Then the next day you get a funny looking thing you can have your Agents work with. It hasn't done anything all day, and you decide, "Well, seems harmless. There's only 86 seconds left to fill out it's log, so let's just get that out of the way while I train my Agents." Then your AI's are spamming you with reports, all you can hear is wind and static, and as you sit in your silly little manager's room, everything on fire around you, you check the last bit of the log that was just filled out... "Past 90 seconds of work the employee dies and all breach counters are reduced to 0." It is at this point, you close the window, and sit there as everything burns. An occasional "Hello?" is heard in the vast reaches of your facility as you smile and sit in silence. The lights go out, frames drop to 0, and your hot AI Secretary comes in to tell you, once again, that you're a failure of a manager. Yet for some, ungodly reason, you manage the strength to hit ESC and then slap the 'Retry Day' button once again. 

It is at this moment, you will realize you love this game. All of it's horrible auto pathing, the micromanaging of your Agents in a fight, the neutral music, and gloriously anticipated moment second trumpet drops. You'll smile, laugh, cry, and feel like you're having a heart attack on day 49 like all the other fans of the game. And maybe you'll find yourself repeating the process over and over again like me.

TLDR; Hot AI Manager, Juicy Lore/Character Development, Time Travel, Frames Drop to 0, Lots of Death, Da Capo Al Fine.
DO NOT PLAY

I have never had my soul removed from my body forcefully and painfully until I downloaded this game. The sheer amount of tears I have made while playing this damn good game would fill the ocean twice over. The only horror in this game is not hte monsters, nor the body gore, but more so the flipping pain of pressing restart so many times, that at this point you could do it in your sleep. I swear, if I ever look at Binah or Hokma again, I will suffer an aneurysm, just from the sheer stress they have given me. 11/10, would suffer again ;w;

[h1]What in the world did I just play and why did it work?[/h1]
82 hours to get the true ending in this roguelite management rng-fest (yes, that's the summary you're gonna get). In short:

The good:
Story, worldbuilding
Gameplay
Boss fights (in a management game hell yeah)

The neutral:
Music
Grind

The bad:
RNG

[b]Story[/b]

Without the story, this game wouldn't be nearly as good as it is. But puzzling together what happened in a lab in the Outskirts, and why that relates to gaining energy from monstrous creatures called abnormalities, while assisted by humanlike AI called Sephirot (all with their own personality and problems) is very enjoyable. The story is given in bits and pieces, out of chronological order and altogether vaguely, which leads to a rather intriguing task of figuring out what went/is going on.

[b]Gameplay[/b]

The gameplay sounds rather simple. You have employees who you can send to work with abnormalities to obtain energy to fill the daily quota. Depending on the employee, the abnormality, the type of work and RNG you will produce more or less energy and the abnormality will or will not get more unhappy. If an abnormality is fully unhappy, bad things happen ranging from employee deaths due to abnormality breakout to... more deaths usually.
The interesting part is that after working with a number of abnormalities, a meltdown occurs. Either, it puts a qliphot meltdown on some random abnormalities which can be removed by working with them, but makes them unhappy if left unattended, or it spawns an ordeal in your facility, forcing combat.
Combat, due to ordeals or escaped abnormalities, can go from simply sending in a blob of high-level employees to micromanaging to avoid attacks, depending on the threat you're up against. All in all, the gameplay loop is nicely put together.

[b]Boss fights[/b]

There are no story spoilers here, but I wanted to tag it anyways.
[spoiler]Boss fights, also known as Sephirot meltdowns, introduce a gimmick for a day and reward you with a buff if you beat them. They are varied and a nice breakup of the regular gameplay loop, and several of them are quite challenging (especially the final boss gauntlet).[/spoiler]


[b]Music[/b]

Although it's nothing special, the music is fitting and doesn't disturb the other elements of the game.

[b]Grind[/b]

Yes, it's one of those. You level up employees by working with abnormalities, and in principle days are infinite. You almost have to level agents further than you would just by reaching the quota, since later boss fights require a bunch of high level employees to deal with everything going on at the same time. Furthermore, to get true ending, you need to have seen every abnormality and filled out their entire bio. This'll take at least two full runs, likely three since RNG isn't in your favour and your first run isn't likely to get all the way to the end if you're unprepared.

[b]RNG[/b]

Oh boy, RNG. The energy you get from working, which abnormalities you get, which ordeal you get, where the ordeals spawn, what abnormalities get a qliphot meltdown, this game is jam-packed with RNG and at several occasions good or bad RNG is the difference between succeeding and having to retry the day (I'm looking at you, Queen of Hatred!). Especially bosses can be highly dependant on a role of the dice, with a wrong role almost forfeiting the attempt.

[b]Conclusion[/b]

Story is good, gameplay is good, until you get to the third run and start to prepare/(grind) for the final boss gauntlet. It's rewarding to complete though, and the story makes most of it worth it.
