What a good game. There's a lot of things I liked about this game. Its soundtracks, story, game mechanics, Abnormalities and so on.

It was a difficult game that required a lot of trial and error, and as someone who aspire to be a completionist, I despise the thought of even a death occurring to one of my agents. Something less than S rank is disgusting, tho people can play with their own playstyle. 
I definitely wouldn't recommend if you hate repetition because you need to repeat a day a lot. But if you know more, it would be easier. It wasn't all good and sunshine, because there were some days that made me suffer again and again, and I made a grave mistake that needs me to restart all over again. Thank goodness there are mods.


In short, it was a game that made me learn true despair and insanity as you see victory within your grasp only for it to disappear over and over again.
This is one of those games that if I could forget it to experience it again, I just might.
Getting literally anybody I know to play this game is harder than day 49. Anyway best story ever created in the universe my mind cannot be changed.

This game gave me mental illness and made me question why I play video games as a whole. 

Angela Hot though so it was all worth it.

This game has praised me. This game has ruined me in ways I didnt know that I would be ruined, i have been fucked over so many time that I fear every waking moment I play it. But game is fun and makes me brain go from brrrr to screaming in seconds its fun :D
Oh, so, wenn PETER PARKER Spaß am Mikromanager-Spiel hat, dann sind es "Spidey-Sinne", aber wenn ich es tue, ICH HABE AUTISMUS?!
Just playing this game make my SP drop to 0

Really fun game. I heard people describe it a lot as being unfair, unforgiving, hating the player, ETC. and that stuff kind of made me think it sounded like it'd be unfun for the sake of being tough, but actually... Most things happen for reasons you can play around, avoid, or be on the lookout for, and the ability to restart a day with what you've learned really makes it feel like Learning the game, rather than just being destroyed again and again for no reason. 
Plus, there are a good handful of different things to motivate gameplay and interacting with things out of your comfort zone, which I appreciate. Abnormality gifts add some priority to try and get your workers interacting with more than just whoever's easy to access and deal with, and the ability to train a worker's stats by using the related work method means there's incentive to have workers do things you know another would already be good at.

If you have any sliver of interest in this game, I'd say pick it up and try it out. This is the type of game that makes me remember why I enjoy games. It's a good experience.
I know I only have 10 hours, and I haven't even reached the midgame, but I've really enjoyed every moment spent with this game so far, so I can easily say I recommend it.

I've never played a harder management simulator to finish in my life. Love the theme, love the mechanics, love the story. Get ready to restart a lot of days though; the difficulty curve for those who don't know the game really well takes off like a rocket later on.

[spoiler] I swear to god though, the 'bosses' that take away your ability to pause the game are absolute evil. My brain and fingers don't work that fast!! [/spoiler]

applist.name: Warhammer: Vermintide 2
applist.detailed_description:
Join our official Discord community


Get the latest news and chat directly with us: https://discord.gg/9BHBX6p


About the Game


Warhammer: Vermintide 2 is a 4-player co-op action game set in the Warhammer Fantasy Battles world. Sequel to the critically acclaimed Vermintide, Vermintide 2 is the latest installment in a franchise best known for its intense and bloody first-person melee combat.

Our five heroes have returned to take on an even greater threat than before – the combined forces of a ruinous Chaos army and the swarming Skaven horde. The only thing standing between utter defeat and victory is you and your allies. If you fall - so too will the Empire.



  • Fight through endless hordes of enemies together with up to 3 friends in this visceral co-op action experience
  • Choose between 5 different characters, each with 3 branching careers to master
  • Evolve your skill and climb the difficulty ladders, from Recruit, Veteran, Champion to Legend
  • Customize your own unique style of play with 15 different talent trees and 50+ Weapon Types
  • Explore the war-ravaged lands of a dying world with a wide range of stunning levels to experience

NOTE: When purchasing Warhammer: Vermintide 2 you will receive 750 Shillings (in-game currency) to spend in the in-game store.

Tried this game for the first time about 2 weeks ago. I think my playtime over that duration speaks for itself here.

The game looks extremely hack and slashy, so I put off checking it out for a long time. That was a mistake. It's surprisingly in-depth with both build variety and combat mechanics. If you want a hack and slash game, the lower difficulties are fine for that, but if you're like me and want something that's going to challenge you and force you to optimize your builds, there's content for that as well.

My only complaint is that some of the DLC weaponry is clearly stronger than the vanilla weaponry, but as far as the vanilla content in the game goes, the vanilla weaponry can handle the content in the hands of a good player anyway. DLCs just offer that extra edge...

I know I'm in the minority with this one, but I feel it just doesn't capture the magic of the first Vermintide.

The maps feel lackluster and everything feels less satisfying. I also miss the cozy inn you return to in between runs. Maybe I'll give it another chance eventually, but it just didn't hook me like the first.

I got into Warhammer thanks to Total War Warhammer 1 and 2. After a friend told me about a first person game set in the world of Warhammer I decided to give it a shot. It was a great decision because Warhammer Vermintide 2 is an amazing game for both fans of Warhammer and people that have no idea or don't care about the setting and lore. The game is similar to Left for Dead, 4 characters go from point A to B while fighting enemies and completing objectives. At the end of some chapters and levels you will fight a boss and or a large horde of enemies.
 The game focuses on melee combat and some gunplay (depending on which character you play as) and one character uses magic. For me I prefer guns and ranged fighting in most games however the melee combat is so good that I have a blast getting up close and personal with great swords, spears and ax's. Aside from the games good range of melee and ranged weapons, you also have a range of powers, hand bombs and power-ups to help you during missions. The game has a large number of missions, bonus content and challenges even if you do not buy any of the DLC's that can be brought fro the store. As of right now, the game is still getting support and content at a slow but steady pace.
 I enjoy the game for a number of reasons. I love the combat, the wide range of weapons, the great visuals and of course the setting. I think that is one of the bigger reasons why I like Vermintide. I fell in love with the Warhammer world thanks to Total War Warhammer and to have a game that takes you right into the World of Warhammer is great. Bouncing back and forth from this game and Total War Warhammer 3 provides endless fun for me.
 I love the five playable characters and the Tavern owner who gives you missions. The banter from the characters is great, although it does help if you know some Warhammer lore beforehand. I am a huge fan of the game, however I do have some issues with this game that will probably never be addressed. The first is the fact that the game is only 4 player Co-Op, not five despite the fact that there are five characters and the game makes it seem like all 5 go out to complete missions together. While 4 player Co-Op is great and it could have been worse (Destiny with 3 player Co-Op outside of cancerous raids comes to mind) it still would make the game even better gameplay and lore wise.
 There is even a character who makes a joke about the lack of 5 player Co-Op multiple times during missions. Another issue I have is lack enemy faction variety. The game does have a wide variety of enemies thanks to the fact that you fight 3 enemy factions. However the game has not added any new enemy factions since the Beastmen came out and new enemies are for the most part never added. At first this is not a big deal, but when you fight Skaven for the 1000th time and when you learn about the massive variety of hostile factions you could and should be fighting (Vampire Counts, other Chaos Gods) you will end up wishing for new factions and enemies to fight.
 Aside from these issues and a few bugs that are not too bothersome, I really enjoy Vermintide and recommend it for Warhammer fans and fans of games like Left for Dead and Payday. May SIGMAR grant this game a long life, and hopefully more Warhammer games.

Horror History Visual Filter Pack


Tailor the aesthetic of The Quarry to your liking by choosing from three cinematic visual filters, each replicating a different era and style of iconic horror filmmaking!

Choose from an 8mm-style film grain (Indie Horror), a retro VHS aesthetic ('80s Horror), or the classic black-and-white cinematic filter (Classic Horror).


The Quarry - Official Trial Version

Experience the thrilling Prologue chapter of The Quarry in this free trial! Trial Version players can also be invited to play online multiplayer by friends who own the full version of The Quarry on Steam via Wolf Pack Mode, and vote on key decisions to create a story shaped by the whole group. Plus, story progress will carry over if you choose to get in on the fun and purchase the full game using the same Steam account! And remember – what doesn’t kill you will make you stronger.


About the Game

As the sun sets on the last day of summer camp, the teenage counselors of Hackett’s Quarry throw a party to celebrate. No kids. No adults. No rules.

Things quickly take a turn for the worse.

Hunted by blood-drenched locals and something far more sinister, the teens' party plans unravel into an unpredictable night of horror. Friendly banter and flirtations give way to life-or-death decisions, as relationships build or break under the strain of unimaginable choices.

Play as each of the nine camp counselors in a thrilling cinematic tale, where every decision shapes your unique story from a tangled web of possibilities. Any character can be the star of the show—or die before daylight comes.

How will your story unfold?


YOUR STORY, THEIR FATE

Will you dare to check what's behind that trap door? Will you investigate the screams echoing from within the forest? Will you save your friends or desperately run for your life? Every choice, big or small, shapes your story and determines who lives to tell the tale.


A STUNNING CINEMATIC EXPERIENCE

Cutting edge facial capture and filmic lighting techniques, combined with incredible performances from an iconic ensemble cast of Hollywood talent, bring the horrors of Hackett’s Quarry to life in a pulse-pounding, cinematic thrill ride.


ENJOY THE FRIGHT WITH FRIENDS

Place your faith in up to 7 friends in online play*, where invited players watch along and vote on key decisions, creating a story shaped by the whole group! Or, play together in a party horror couch co-op experience where each player picks a counselor and controls their actions.


CUSTOMIZE YOUR EXPERIENCE

Adjustable difficulty for all gameplay elements let players of any skill level enjoy the horror. And if you prefer to watch rather than play, Movie Mode lets you enjoy The Quarry as a binge-worthy cinematic thriller. Select how you want the story to unfold, kick back, and munch on some popcorn in between all the screams!

STARRING:


David Arquette as Chris
Ariel Winter as Abigail
Brenda Song as Kaitlyn
Evan Evagora as Nick
Halston Sage as Emma
Justice Smith as Ryan
Miles Robbins as Dylan
Siobhan Williams as Laura
Skyler Gisondo as Max
Zach Tinker as Jacob
Ethan Suplee as Bobby
Grace Zabriskie as Eliza
Lance Henriksen as Jedediah
Lin Shaye as Constance
Ted Raimi as Travis



*Online multiplayer functionality will be available post-launch on or by July 8, 2022.

reviews.review: unreal. good graphics. so many different playthroughs. vey addicting.

Great story! Probably one of the only games in this series so far that I got into the story. The first one also was great but the disappointment I always had was that the supernatural element was always explained by a scientific reason. This one kept the element of suspense all the way through and I would love to see more about these characters.

kaitlyn carried
9.5/10

*No spoilers*

Generally:
This game is pretty damn good. I think I can say I'm a fan. If you played until dawn, its pretty similar. A pretty balanced amount of interactive quick time event cut scenes as well as little moments in the game that allow you to explore a find things like clues and tarot cards and other interact-able things. The only frustrating thing though is that sometimes its impossible to tell if the next thing you press A on will send you to the next scene, or if it will allow you to keep exploring. The other thing is that you really gotta be careful about which moves you make at times because you might make a decision that just straight up gets a character killed and there is nothing you can do about it. However, a majority of the time its pretty controllable. You really have to play this game multiple times through to truly understand what happens after which move you make. I think this game is more for people who want a good story (and be able to manipulate it!).

The story:
The general story sounds pretty stereotypical and generic, but I was anxious and genuinely surprised the entire playthrough of this story.  Most if not all of this story is pretty exciting and unpredictable. The rest of the game is trying to put the pieces together and understanding what is going on. There really is a lot of parts to the story that kept me on the edge of my seat. The way they conveyed this story in the way that they did, made it so good. The mischievousness of the chronology of this game was amazing, and it wasn't confusing to follow along with. It was also really satisfying to find clues and figure out details of the story, to be later confirmed by a character explaining what is happening. 

Quick time Events (QTE's)
There is a whole bunch of these. In action packed points, and even in calmer moments of the game. Its a cool idea, and it keeps the player's attention when watching long unskippable cutscenes. I honestly thought this game would be boring and more like a movie, but its really not. QTE's are placed generously and I think that there is not too much and not too little. Im probably gonna play this multiple times through. 


One last thing for the developers and I guess anyone else:
PLEASE PLEASE do something about the credits. It was insatiably excruciating to have to sit on the UNSKIPPABLE credits screen for 25+ minutes. This is such a heinous way to end this game. I liked the little updates after the game ended on every character, which was fine, but maybe instead of making us sit through the entire goddamn credits to get a stupid achievement and have the game actually count as finished, why don't you have a sanctimonious cutscene at the end of the game with all of the survived characters meeting up in the front of the lodge? or SOMETHING?? The podcast was a cool added touch, but the podcast only plays for about half the time you have to watch the credits. You have to watch the rest of the credits with some added music. Like literally who in the entire universe wants to watch a credits scene with one singular visual of a computer screen and the same newspaper heading for 25 minutes. Even with the podcast in the background, I wanted to blow my brains out having to sit through those credits. It's worse than going to a marvel movie and having to wait for the post-credit scenes. Because those credits are shorter. Somehow.


Stability:
This game seems to have pretty good optimization, with occasional stuttering. 
Seemed to run smooth 90-150 FPS at high-ultra settings, on a GTX 3060 and Intel 13600KF and 16GB memory.
This game is probably one of the least glitch filled games I have played as of recently that is a new game. In fact I didn't experience a single game breaking bug, or anything that was bad enough to remember. There is a very slight visual thing when models are set before the camera switches angles, and you can sometimes see hair or clothes falling from items spawning. Other than that, this game is essentially perfect, for my standards. Respect to Supermassive Games for actually testing and bug fixing the game before releasing it, unlike every AAA developer these days. 


I highly recommend this game, especially for anyone who wants a good story and doesn't care to be doing something the entire playthrough.

I liked it, but it's not a game, it's an interactive movie. In about 7 hours of gameplay, I think you have 10 minutes of actual interaction, the rest is cinematic. 
The camera movements are limited, there is no real interaction, you can't run, skip scenes or fast-forward. The game has many functions that don't make sense. The characters' personalities don't make sense and many dialogues are pointless.

However, The graphics are very good. The setting and the story are great. Some of the actors are good too. The music is also very good.
Fantastic game loved playing and replaying for all the different outcomes, so much fun. This game has great characters with a story rich environment and great for Halloween or spooky season.
very good. very fun. dont take it too seriously. have fun with it.

The Quarry is a lot of fun, with throwback vibes and a style extremely reminiscent of 80's horror films. The game does a really great job of faking out the player's expectations several times over, and the script provides a surprising amount of heart from the cast. 

The atmosphere of the game is fantastic, and there are some clever details that I really enjoyed - I particularly liked that the "Paths" tracking system offers a VHS slip cover for the major decisions made, acting as though individual turning points were separate movies. The interim scenes with the fortune teller are also a great touch, blurring the line between narrator and story character.

The graphics are also fantastic, and offer a lot of visual detail such as stubble, pockmarks, imperfect teeth, and scars. One really neat bit is that the game's menu shows a 3D face of the character you're playing as, and reflects their updated appearances based on what's happening in the scene. I actually thought this was an incredibly cool idea, in that it adds to the overall sense of game immersion.

The only real downside, I feel, is that there's not a lot of replay value once you beat it. The mystery is no longer a mystery, the chain of outcomes becomes fairly obvious in hindsight, and the fact that you revert decisions after beating the game doesn't quite make up for the fact that you can't skip cutscenes and effectively have to play the whole game onwards from the point the change was made. The characters kind of walk slowly most of the time, too.

All in all, fantastic game with a fun atmosphere, great cast, and interesting story. In some aspects, it feels like a revitalization of classic point-and-click mystery adventure games, designed around modern gaming sensibilities. Absolutely worth at least one playthrough.
The IQ of the characters is probably half of the global average, but it was still an enjoyable experience.
Constance is love, Constance is life

I like all the games from Dark Anthology series, and this one, although it's spin-off, is my favourite of them all, the settings, the characters and the performance of the actors is just the best of all the Anthology games.
Certified Hood Classic™

Another great game from supermassive. Its a bit more complex and detailed than the dark picture anthology series from same developer.For some reason my steam gaming hours don't add up.

I feel like as i grow older and getting less and less time to play games after work or in holidays , i am enjoying more games like this one with quick QTES rather than Open world/grindy/multiplayer games.

applist.name: Barotrauma
applist.detailed_description:
Buzz

https://store.steampowered.com/app/1485690/Potion_Tycoon/


DISCORD


About the Game

"Work together to explore and survive, and/or sabotage one another and let the ship go down in fire and flood."
- Rock Paper Shotgun

WELCOME TO EUROPA

Barotrauma is a 2D co-op survival horror submarine simulator, inspired by games like FTL: Faster Than Light, Rimworld, Dwarf Fortress and Space Station 13. It’s a Sci-Fi game that combines ragdoll physics and alien sea monsters with teamwork and existential fear.

EMBRACE THE ABYSS

In the not too distant future, humanity has fled to Jupiter’s moon. With its irradiated icy surface, life can only be found in the ocean below. Travel through a punishing underwater environment and make friends or rivals of the four factions of the world. Discover what lies in the depths of Europa.

HELP YOUR CREW SUCCEED, OR MAKE SURE NO ONE DOES

There are as many ways to enjoy Barotrauma as there are ways to die in it. Work together with your crew to achieve your goals, or brace for betrayal when you have a traitor on board. Play with friends, strangers, or your worst enemies.

EXPLORE, OPERATE, COMMUNICATE

Navigate underwater, complete missions for the last remnants of humankind, explore the ruins of an alien civilization, flee or fight monsters. Operate complex on-board systems and devices like the sonar, nuclear reactor, weapons, engines and pumps. Communication is key!

EXPERIMENT, CRAFT, CREATE

Master the complex on-board wiring and the comprehensive crafting and medical systems. Create your own submarines and monsters with built-in editors to rival the standard ones. Even tap directly into our source code and mod away.

Features

  • Play with up to 16 players on board a submarine. Supplement your player count with bots as needed in either singleplayer or multiplayer game modes.
  • 6 player classes with different skills and tasks: Captain, Engineer, Mechanic, Medic, Security officer and Assistant.
  • Talent system: Gain experience and unlock talents to improve your character. Each class has three specialization talent trees to customize your playstyle.
  • Faction and reputation mechanics: Choose who to ally with, help their cause, reap the benefits or suffer the consequences.
  • Procedurally generated world and missions with multiple game modes for virtually endless replayability.
  • Comprehensive crafting system: gather materials, craft equipment, weapons, medicines and more to help your crew survive on Europa.
  • Built-in Submarine, Character and Procedural Animation editors. Share and discover mods directly via Steam Workshop.
  • Most game data exposed in .xml and the game’s source code publicly available on GitHub for modding.

content_descriptors.notes: Contains violence, gore, and drug use.

reviews.review:
Be Captain
Chilling (going top speed)
Turn on active sonar
5 Hammerheads ahead
Engage the Hammerheads at full speed
Submarine comes to a complete stop and starts sinking extremely fast 
Sub keeps sinking
Eventually sink into the abyss and see Charybdis health bar 
Literally opens the entire top half of the sub like a can opener
Slams against the abyss floor and I get on the top gun to help fire at it
See crew mates swimming downward attempting to make it back (They got launched out of the top of the sub)
Charybdis kills and eats every one swimming back to the sub
Shoot and watch in horror as it picks off everyone outside
Eventually kill it and repair the hull
Do a role call and find out we lost 75% of everyone on the ship
The sub is quiet and we finally make it to the next station

10/10 very traumatizing

Take my review with a grain of salt because I started right after 1.0 release. I just started solo missions after 210 hours played so most of my experience is random multiplayer. This is one game that's very hard to convince friends to play. That's alright though, I made several friends within random Barotrauma games so I have people to play with now. The best part, is the sheer amount of people from different countries you play with.

I'm a person that thrives on multiplayer games, and particularly ones that make jumping into random games enjoyable. Barotrauma gives you a completely unique experience when it comes to being "enjoyable." This game is just downright unrelenting. You're either fighting monsters, teammates, and even your own sanity. 

My first multiplayer game made me dive straight into the hydrothermal wastes on hard difficulty. The chaos, camaraderie, and consternation within a 30-minute timeline was an immediate adrenaline rush. Recovering from something so bad felt so satisfying. Barotrauma never lets me down with their RNG trying to constantly destroy us. This is a very good thing in my opinion. Every mission will keep you on your toes and wondering if you'll even survive the trip. Whether it's from a really unlucky swarm with a golden hammerhead, or just your own teammates panic shooting everywhere.

There are bads of course, such as griefers but you learn to work around those types. I've never ran into any game-breaking bugs nor have I gotten a single crash yet. Although getting stuck on the hatch/ladder does get annoying at times. (especially with the bots.... ) At least ragdoll is a quick remedy.

I've always been a huge fan of Europa and that's what got me to look into this game. I hope with the future updates, we'll get more info about the lore of the game. There's just so many questions.
I got this game for like 20 dollars or something and its fun and cool but holy shit 50 dollars what the hell.
Truly one of the games ever made

TLDR: I like this game ALOT but some fixes to fighting, and mechanics can heavily improve it.

This game is addictively difficult. An in depth medical system, reputation system, and many roles/jobs to choose fun. The atmosphere is creepy and the style is pretty unique. The game is best enjoyed with friends rather than alone,  you wont enjoy dealing with NPCs and will get lonely. The lore was interesting and the ending had my friends and I hyped and curious. The final battle we were on edge but excited. I would definitely recommend this game. 

However please for the love of Jove fix some things or change them. Revert clown back to it's previous state. Part of the appeal of playing assistant was the grind to get to clown. Clown was a funny pick and useful, the ability to honk the horn in order to help the crew fix things and eventually the chance to annihilate enemies with a squeaky hammer is cool and hilarious. I found myself rarely using the squeaky hammer because all it does it revive teammates (under a specific circumstance) and the horn now only gives a stat boost and a chance to stun enemies. 

The game is difficult but it's made doubly difficult by annoying mechanics and controls. The biggest annoyance is being knocked out of any UI/controls at the slightest bump or movement. A monster gives your ship a tap, you're knocked off the guns, someone opens a door and a drop of water touches, knocked off whatever you're on. Speaking of water the rushing water is more problematic than the monsters. It doesn't matter if it's gallons of water rushing in or water up to your ankles, you WILL be knocked off your feet and prevented from using guns or fixing electronics or machines or moving to other parts of the sub (And yes I know we're deep underwater so it's pressurized and probably has a lot of power behind it but still. It's usually too low to swim in and yet too high to walk/run through). Maybe just change how easily it is to be knocked out of UI/controls, where only massive amounts of shaking/movement will cause it rather anything & everything. Maybe change how rushing water interacts with the players, with only large amounts knocking the player over and smaller amounts only slightly slowing them rather than pushing them and preventing them from closing doors or stopping leaks.

Another issue is the combat. It's a 2D game which means it's extremely hard NOT to friendly fire. The amount of times I have been unable to help a friend out for fear of hurting them is massive, and the amount of times i've shot them is more massive. I don't know how this could be fixed or improved but it makes multiplayer a struggle. You can't really all work together to defeat a monster unless it's sandwiched between you two and even them you still somehow end up dealing damage to teammates. 
While on the topic of combat, mobs SHOULD NOT have the ability to spam EMP type abilities/moves. This is mainly an issue towards the end of the game, but it causes annoyance because there is absolutely nothing you can do to prevent or even fix it. If mobs do have emp abilities make it to wear they have to recharge for more than like 2 minutes or so. Because otherwise they spam it and you're unable to fix anything and attack back. 

Finally maybe just add backpacks into the vanilla game, the storage being an issue at the beginning is fun and the toolbelt could be use for extra storage but it can only help so much.

I say all this because I do love this game, otherwise I wouldn't have so many hours in it and I wouldn't have beaten it. I just want to see it improved so others wont be turned off by it.
I love when the insane doctor loads me up with combat stims, meth, cocaine, 5 doses of morphine and a bloodpack so I can continue my knife fight with god.
its alright

Back to looking at SONAR. I'm so SONAR-pilled.

This game made me try to build a mini underwater base for a mouse to live in, in real life.
I started a husk outbreak on a random server 10/10 would do again

Barotrauma instantly transported me back to my days playing Space Station 13, one of the most unique and memorable gaming experiences I've ever had. Like SS13, Barotrauma perfectly captures the madness, chaos and teamwork of trying to survive in a cramped and chaotic space environment.

The levels of systemic depth and emergent gameplay are astounding. Every game feels like a unique story as different threats arise and your crew responds on the fly to overcome them. From explosions that rupture holes in the hull to space leviathans that threaten to tear the sub apart, there is no shortage of peril. How your crew coordinates their skills and resources to survive these dangers feels endlessly replayable and rewarding.

The art style, while simple, adds to the nostalgic feel and helps keep performance smooth even during the most hectic moments. And the sounds of metal creaking, oxygen escaping and the sub's engines struggling add so much to the atmosphere of barely hanging on by a thread.

If you ever dreamed of escaping your space station to go on incredible deep space expeditions, rather than just fixing toilets and grabbing food from the vending machine, then Barotrauma is the game for you. It captures that same sense of madness and teamwork, but with a single-minded goal of survival that will keep you and your crew coming back for more adventures into the depths.

This is my favorite horror game, I have played other games like dead space, and genesis alpha one but I always wanted to be part of a crew like Alien and this game exceeded my expectations I say follow the tutorial if you don't your going to fail or you won't enjoy it as much. Also yes, you can play with friends or solo with A.I teammates. If you have any questions don't hesitate to ask I will be more then welcome to help
extremely fun once you get the hang of it!

Excellent sandbox environment where the sky is truly the limit! It starts VERY slow because you HAVE to build towards the endgame and accumulate all the resources and equipment to unlock the total environment of fun and chaos!  Stick with it and it will reward you like no other game has.  The mod community is a MUST, as they have poured their hearts and souls into content that really is AAA quality. 177 hours of play time.

Monster hunter levels of grind and possibility with every bit of the reward for doing so.

applist.name: Timberborn
applist.detailed_description:
JOIN OUR COMMUNITY

Join our Discord server to share your feedback and discuss all things Timberborn.


About the Game

Mankind turned Earth into a dry wasteland and perished, but some species adapted and evolved. Pick one of the beaver factions and see how long your colony can last.

Beaver societies



Control one of two beaver factions: the nature-friendly Folktails or the industrious Iron Teeth. Each faction has a unique style, buildings, and gameplay traits. Choose what fits your playstyle!

Wet and dry seasons



Prepare your settlement for recurring droughts. Stockpile on food and keep fields and forests alive even after rivers dry up. Rely on both natural water sources and artificial irrigation to keep the land arable.

River control



Beavers of the future have millennia of experience in water engineering. Put up dams and floodgates, dig canals with explosives, and redirect rivers to bring life back to the wasteland. Just be careful with that dynamite.

Lumberpunk



Turn timber into sophisticated machinery – from water wheels and sawmills to engines and mechanized pumps. Wood is the core resource in Timberborn, but the most advanced structures require metal. To find it, send your scavengers to the ruins of the old world.

Bots



Supercharge your colony with mechanized beavers! Power them up, maintain them, and you'll get extra efficient workers for almost any job. They will literally move mountains for you thanks to their unique ability to put up land blocks.

Vertical architecture



Create a thriving beaver settlement using a vertical architecture system. Space is limited, so stack lodges and workshops on top of each other, construct platforms and bridges, and set up a power grid for your growing population.

Day and night cycle



Build a multi-district city with efficient production chains and nighttime activities. Follow the lives of individually simulated inhabitants throughout their day and celebrate when the next generation is born!

Wellbeing



An evolved beaver's lifestyle is not just "work, sleep and chomp on wood". Satisfy the needs of your rodents with a balanced diet, decorations, monuments, and more – on top of keeping the colony alive.

Map editor



Play on one of the included maps or create your own and share it with the community! With hills of different heights, ruins scattered in the desert, and all life depending on access to water, each map poses a different challenge.

...and more!

Ever since the project started, we have been improving the game and adding new features based on community feedback. We’re making the world’s first beaver city-builder so if you want to carve it with us, hop into Timberborn Early Access!

reviews.review:
Nice, no stress, city builder. Unless of course you over extend your district and suddenly there is famine of massive scale due to food and water shortages. Many, many beavers died... :(

10/10 will dam again...

Timberborn is an incredibly charming and engaging city-building game that puts players in control of a colony of industrious beavers. The game offers a unique twist on the genre, combining the familiar aspects of city-building and resource management with a quirky, post-apocalyptic setting. 

---{ Graphics }---
☑ Beautiful: Timberborn's graphics are both visually appealing and endearing. The game boasts a detailed, colorful, and vibrant world filled with charming beaver characters and their impressive structures. The distinct art style and attention to detail make it easy to get lost in the game's environment, adding to the overall immersion.

---{ Gameplay }---
☑ Good: Timberborn offers an engaging and satisfying city-building experience, with players tasked with constructing and managing their beaver colony. The game introduces unique mechanics, such as the dry and wet seasons, which challenge players to manage resources effectively and plan for future expansion. Additionally, the game features a tech tree that allows players to unlock new buildings and upgrades, providing a sense of progression and motivation to expand their colony.

---{ Audio }---
☑ Very good: Timberborn's audio design is top-notch, with a calming and soothing soundtrack that complements the game's atmosphere perfectly. The sound effects for construction, resource gathering, and beaver interactions are well-executed and contribute to the game's overall charm.

---{ Audience }---
☑ Kids, Teens, Adults: Timberborn is accessible and enjoyable for players of all ages. The game's straightforward mechanics and intuitive user interface make it easy for younger players to pick up and enjoy, while the city-building challenges and resource management aspects provide depth and complexity for more experienced players.

---{ PC Requirements }---
☑ Decent: Timberborn runs smoothly on a wide range of systems, requiring only moderate hardware specifications. This accessibility ensures that more players can enjoy the game without worrying about system performance.

---{ Difficulty }---
☑ Easy: Timberborn's difficulty is well-balanced, with a gentle learning curve that eases players into the game's mechanics. The game offers enough challenge to keep players engaged, without becoming overwhelming or frustrating.

---{ Grind }---
☑ Nothing to grind: Timberborn is focused on city-building and resource management, with no need to grind for resources or experience points. This design choice keeps the gameplay experience fresh and enjoyable, without tedious repetition.

---{ Story }---
☑ Some lore: Timberborn provides a basic premise and some background information on the post-apocalyptic world, but the primary focus is on the gameplay and city-building aspects.

---{ Game Time }---
☑ To infinity and beyond: Timberborn offers near-limitless possibilities for city-building and colony expansion, providing countless hours of replayability and enjoyment.

---{ Price }---
☑ Worth the price: Timberborn's engaging gameplay, charming graphics, and unique take on the city-building genre make it well worth the price.

---{ Bugs }---
☑ Minor bugs: Timberborn has a few minor bugs, but the developers are actively working to address them, and they do not significantly detract from the overall experience.

---{ Overall Score: 8 / 10 }---
Timberborn is a delightful and engaging city-building game that offers a unique twist on the genre, thanks to its charming beaver characters and post-apocalyptic setting. The game's beautiful graphics, satisfying gameplay, and soothing audio make it a must-play for fans of city-building and resource management games.
In less than 2 hours, this intriguing game achieved what 8 years of anti-depressants have failed to accomplish.

Was a good game until update 4 requires too much micromanaging of storage buildings. Buildings used to accept a bunch of different resource types, but now the building only will accept one type of resource, and you have to manually select it on each new building.

If i have a farming area, with potatoes, sunflowers, carrots, wheat,  berries, and dandelions, i need  6 warehouses for the raw materials, and then more warehouses for the secondary products (baked potato, flour, bread)  

Before, i could start with making one warehouse, then just add more as i needed the capacity, allowing resources to be spent on other things as the game progresses. 

It turned a relaxing game into a pain

300h+ played, never got boring!
every map feels different and perfecting one city/map can take weeks.
can also be played slow and lazy and in easy mode, still will feel great and the awesome water mechanics make it different than all the other similar games out there.

it's early access, but even months ago it felt better than most triple A building games out there. 

fully recommended!

Time flies when you're playing this game. 

What I love about it:
- No enemies or hostility of any sport. The beavers are the overlords of the land.
- Relaxed pace - once you learn how to manage water and start stockpiling resources, droughts stop being a threat.
- Beavers!

This is like every outstanding city builder you have ever played only it keeps getting better as they improve in EA. One of the few EA games I have that I keep playing. 

I do wish there was a way to use the robots + Stream Gauge + floodgate to automate floodgate controls.

I still hate the industrial Beavers - having their birth rate require micro management is not fun. It is not how anything else in the game works or how the other race handles birthrates. If this is a "design" of the race I don't care - I don't like it so I don't play 1/2 of the game.
Beaver : )

EY, KURWA, BOBER!
JA PIERDOLE

I absolutely LOVE this game! It has almost everything I could want from a survival/city-builder type game. 

The mechanics are well thought out, and have been refined even more after the recent update. It also offers a custom difficulty setting which I honestly wish all games had! I play on a potato so can't speak to graphics, but what I can see on my laptop is adorable. So far I'd definitely say it was worth every penny spent - don't let the fact that it's in "Early Access" scare you off, I'm so glad I didn't wait.

Bottom line: if you want a cute, fun and challenging game about Beavers, this is the game for you!

Honestly for a city builder it feels really restrictive. There seems to be one "correct" way to play and deviating from that usually results in you being punished by the drought RNG. Sad as I love the aesthetic :(
It's adorable
before this game, there really wasnt a beaver-based city builder that focused on water manipulation. but now there is.

Learn from the humans' mistakes by repeating exactly what led to their downfall...
- Mass deforestation for resources and agriculture, 
- Pollution, and 
- Overpopulation.

Smart little beavers... 🌳🌲

Super cute little post-apocalypse town builder sim. Would love more story and/or missions, I assume that'll be coming in the full release. Even without it's an absorbing infinite build, expand, survive play.

Within 7 hours I mastered the art of thy Carrot. Continuously improving the carrots flavor and texture and eventually becoming the Carrot Master. Droughts haunted me no longer for the Beavers had an infinite supply of snowman noses. Do not recommend if you are afraid of Beavers.

The game has got a long way to go but it has already gone so far, very happy with this and highly recommend letting all but 10 of your population die every drought so that process can always be made for future generations!

It's all fun and games until all of my beavers die because they're too sad to harvest their carrots fast enough to not starve.

10/10 would accidentally cause mass famine again

Good beaver game. It really scratches that itch of an environment restoration city builder. I love the beaver water flow mechanics, it makes you think like a beaver. Historically I have found city builders to be unplayably complicated and no fun once I do figure things out. It's nice that this game only has like 3 major mechanics to figure out and the rest is all minor stuff that adds to the fun parts of the game.

My only gripes so far: 
First, I had a drought that took my 200+ population down to 1 and I didn't get a game over, nor did I get like a special event of a wandering beaver coming to join my ghost town of a settlement. It took me a while to figure out that I was essentially locked until my remaining beaver eventually died of old age and that the game wasn't going to do anything to stop me or help me at that point.
Second, the graphics are lacking for a modern city builder, the visual style fits but it lacks character in a lot of the textures and the texture quality is overall pretty low. Too many right angles with the buildings, beavers don't build right angles smh.

A fun game about post-apocalyptic beaver survival.  It's been getting regular updates in early access, but it's already pretty enjoyable as-is.  There are a still a few low-hanging QoL features that the developers could implement, but community mods have most of these covered already.

applist.name: Bramble: The Mountain King
applist.detailed_description:
MORE GREAT GAMES


Don't get lost, follow us!


About the Game


Bramble The Mountain King takes you on a gripping and unsettling journey through stunning environments. Take on the role of Olle, a young boy setting off to rescue his sister, kidnapped by a dreaded troll.




Not everything in Bramble is exactly how it seems - in this strange land with creatures big and small, you must be careful when to approach and when to hide. Many hungry and spiteful beasts lurk in these forests and caves. Watch your step....




Call upon the Spark of Courage, an enchanted fragment granting the gifts you need to endure the pitfalls and trials in your path. Defeat the horrid creatures you encounter in different and unique ways. Be warned, courage without kindness can take you down a dark path.




  • Adventure as Olle, a brave boy who sets off to rescue his sister.
  • A beautiful yet dangerous world to explore.
  • Encounter twisted, mythical creatures from Nordic folklore for epic-scale boss battles.
  • Tense, heart-pounding moments with hi-end visuals to match.

https://store.steampowered.com/app/1623940/Bramble_The_Mountain_King/

content_descriptors.notes: Throughout the game, you will meet and defeat monsters in the form of bosses. These scenes will be violent and bloody. Some of the monsters may have human traits, but all are monsters/creatures in Nordic folklore. In addition, you will be able to see dead creatures or animals in magical forests, these create storytelling around the trolls' everyday life. Some fantasy creatures have bodies that resemble the human shape, sometimes they appear semi-nude or wearing revealing clothing.

reviews.review:
Best game I've played in a few years. The mythology throughout is a joy to experience. What an emotional journey. 10/10

also great music. Made me cry several times
reviews.developer_response: Thank you for playing Bramble: The Mountain King and for your kind words, we're so happy to hear of your experience in the game!

reviews.review: As a scandinavian, I recognized a lot of the myths and creatures in this game. It was amazing playing through it. However, it did feel a bit weird with the english with then swedish names in it. Might be because I'm scandinavian, but I really felt during the game that a swedish voice would have fit the game even more than the english did, and made the game even more immersive, for my part at least. That is just a nitpick though, amazing game.

You loved Little Nightmares? The Witcher? Inside? Edith Finch? Please just go for it, you won't regret any second. Absolute Masterpiece!!! Gorgeous graphics, sceneries, storytelling, character designs, creatures. Will now follow the work of the Dimfrost Studio closely, these devs truly realised a work of love. This game is now in my top list of favourite game ever, and it's been a while since any game had this impact on me! Gosh I just want moooooore
My only complaint is I wish the game was longer.
Excellent art and an interesting story. Very dark and creepy when it wants to be. My only complaint is that it's kind of short!
if you ever played and enjoyed little nightmares you will love this game!

Just wow! Amazing soundtrack, really cool graphic and wonderful thrilling story! Absolutely loved every minute of this awesome adventure game! If you're still on the fence, stop, just try it. Lemus one love! <3

Phenomenal game with a brilliant soundtrack, story, and one of the coolest bossfights I've seen in a while. 

Heavily recommended!

This game is good, but unlike Little Nightmares i do not see much replay ability. I wish there was a new game + mode where you could play your sister looking for her brother instead of vice versa. I think the devs did an amazing job, however this game could easily have more replay in it. All in all it only took me about 5 hours to beat, and I looked for all the secrets. 5 hours for 30$? Not sure if that's really worth it. Please add new game +

Really enjoyed this game! As a native Swede it was so refreshing to see some proper Swedish lore and environments. The horror elements are on point, the environments are amazing and the SFX/Soundtrack is damn good! The art is on point (lots of John Bauer inspired stuff), great voice actors and designs. HOWEVER, some of the puzzles was super weird and the auto-lock on system could have had some work before release. I was also bummed out by the weird depth of field, motion blur and grain combined with very very dark areas and it was hard to see what you were doing half of the times. Luckily some amazing individual posted a solution to remove this in a ini file under Windows/Users/(Your user)/AppData/Local/Bramble_TMK/Saved/Config/WindowsNoEditor and then open the Engine.ini file with notepad, and add this text under all the text in that ini file:
[SystemSettings]
r.MotionBlur.PreferCompute=0
r.DepthOfFieldQuality=0
r.MotionBlur.Max=0
r.MotionBlurQuality=0
r.DefaultFeature.MotionBlur=0
r.Tonemapper.GrainQuantization=0
r.Tonemapper.Quality=0

I feel like these graphics settings should be added into the game, and hopefully the devs will in the future. 
Another thing that other people are complaining about is the price, but I think 30 EUR is more than fair, this world is currently on fire with inflation, we're all trying to get by, especially smaller dev companies. And I'd much rather pay 30 EUR for this game than giving EA or Ubisoft 60, 70, 80, 100(!) bucks for some other half-baked non-ambitious game. 

8/10. Strongly recommend!
Everything in this game saw me as a snack. Im flattered.

This game is amazing! It seamlessly transitions from a charming fairy tale setting to a spine-tingling horror experience, which feels natural and impressive. If you're a fan of games such as Little Nightmares and Limbo, you'll definitely love this one!
Well things escalated quickly to say the least. Recommended for the very young kids, like 3-10 y olds. That is if you wanna induce some psychological damage in them. Great piece of art. Bye.
This game absolutely deserves the Overwhelmingly Positive rating. It is truly a masterpiece. A work of art in every way. It may not be very long, but it is certainly worth every penny.
Holy sh@t.
Some kinks in controls and intuitiveness needs to be address but this is a gorgeous and super awesome game. Very reminiscent of Little Nightmares with a Fae-ish storytelling twist.

Pros:
- Graphics
- Atmosphere and camera
- Music
- One boss design is good

Cons:
- Too short for this price ($30 for 6 hours, no replay value)
- Story for 6 years old
- Very basic gameplay, repetitive sometimes like hide-wait-go cycle gameplay in 3 separated chapters
- Too few bosses, most of the time you're walking and doing basic platforming
- GPU usage is alway 100% even if at menu screen or switch to another workspace

Overall it's not bad, the major issue is $30 for 6 hours, wait for discount.
if you like Little Nightmares you will like this game
This game was beautiful, eerie and trippy. I loved the music as it changed in different moments. I would recommend this.

Absolutely stunning game, visuals, sound, and atmosphere are all amazing. I just wish that it didn't play like a movie tie in game for the playstation 2.

The second half of the game really shows what I would have liked to see more of, with interesting changes to the puzzles and actual things to play. I just wish I didn't have to sit through walking 5 ft into a cutscene for an hour to get there.

applist.name: Grand Theft Auto V
applist.detailed_description:
When a young street hustler, a retired bank robber and a terrifying psychopath find themselves entangled with some of the most frightening and deranged elements of the criminal underworld, the U.S. government and the entertainment industry, they must pull off a series of dangerous heists to survive in a ruthless city in which they can trust nobody, least of all each other.

Grand Theft Auto V for PC offers players the option to explore the award-winning world of Los Santos and Blaine County in resolutions of up to 4k and beyond, as well as the chance to experience the game running at 60 frames per second.

The game offers players a huge range of PC-specific customization options, including over 25 separate configurable settings for texture quality, shaders, tessellation, anti-aliasing and more, as well as support and extensive customization for mouse and keyboard controls. Additional options include a population density slider to control car and pedestrian traffic, as well as dual and triple monitor support, 3D compatibility, and plug-and-play controller support.

Grand Theft Auto V for PC also includes Grand Theft Auto Online, with support for 30 players and two spectators. Grand Theft Auto Online for PC will include all existing gameplay upgrades and Rockstar-created content released since the launch of Grand Theft Auto Online, including Heists and Adversary modes.

The PC version of Grand Theft Auto V and Grand Theft Auto Online features First Person Mode, giving players the chance to explore the incredibly detailed world of Los Santos and Blaine County in an entirely new way.

Grand Theft Auto V for PC also brings the debut of the Rockstar Editor, a powerful suite of creative tools to quickly and easily capture, edit and share game footage from within Grand Theft Auto V and Grand Theft Auto Online. The Rockstar Editor’s Director Mode allows players the ability to stage their own scenes using prominent story characters, pedestrians, and even animals to bring their vision to life. Along with advanced camera manipulation and editing effects including fast and slow motion, and an array of camera filters, players can add their own music using songs from GTAV radio stations, or dynamically control the intensity of the game’s score. Completed videos can be uploaded directly from the Rockstar Editor to YouTube and the Rockstar Games Social Club for easy sharing.

Soundtrack artists The Alchemist and Oh No return as hosts of the new radio station, The Lab FM. The station features new and exclusive music from the production duo based on and inspired by the game’s original soundtrack. Collaborating guest artists include Earl Sweatshirt, Freddie Gibbs, Little Dragon, Killer Mike, Sam Herring from Future Islands, and more. Players can also discover Los Santos and Blaine County while enjoying their own music through Self Radio, a new radio station that will host player-created custom soundtracks.

Special access content requires Rockstar Games Social Club account. Visit http://rockstargames.com/v/bonuscontent for details.

Grand Theft Auto V for PC also includes Grand Theft Auto Online, with support for 30 players and two spectators. Grand Theft Auto Online for PC will include all existing gameplay upgrades and Rockstar-created content released since the launch of Grand Theft Auto Online, including Heists and Adversary modes.

The PC version of Grand Theft Auto V and Grand Theft Auto Online features First Person Mode, giving players the chance to explore the incredibly detailed world of Los Santos and Blaine County in an entirely new way.

Grand Theft Auto V for PC also brings the debut of the Rockstar Editor, a powerful suite of creative tools to quickly and easily capture, edit and share game footage from within Grand Theft Auto V and Grand Theft Auto Online. The Rockstar Editor’s Director Mode allows players the ability to stage their own scenes using prominent story characters, pedestrians, and even animals to bring their vision to life. Along with advanced camera manipulation and editing effects including fast and slow motion, and an array of camera filters, players can add their own music using songs from GTAV radio stations, or dynamically control the intensity of the game’s score. Completed videos can be uploaded directly from the Rockstar Editor to YouTube and the Rockstar Games Social Club for easy sharing.

Soundtrack artists The Alchemist and Oh No return as hosts of the new radio station, The Lab FM. The station features new and exclusive music from the production duo based on and inspired by the game’s original soundtrack. Collaborating guest artists include Earl Sweatshirt, Freddie Gibbs, Little Dragon, Killer Mike, Sam Herring from Future Islands, and more. Players can also discover Los Santos and Blaine County while enjoying their own music through Self Radio, a new radio station that will host player-created custom soundtracks.

Special access content requires Rockstar Games Social Club account. Visit http://rockstargames.com/v/bonuscontent for details.
applist.short_description: Grand Theft Auto V for PC offers players the option to explore the award-winning world of Los Santos and Blaine County in resolutions of up to 4k and beyond, as well as the chance to experience the game running at 60 frames per second.

Grand Theft Auto 5 is a masterpiece in the gaming industry. From the moment you start the game, you are completely immersed in a world that is rich with detail and possibility. The open world nature of the game is breathtaking, allowing you to explore and experience all the city has to offer. The game’s graphics are simply stunning, bringing to life the gritty city of Los Santos.

The gameplay in Grand Theft Auto 5 is incredibly dynamic and diverse. Whether you want to go on a crime spree, explore the city, or simply enjoy the nightlife, the game offers something for everyone. The story is also engaging and full of twists and turns that keep you on the edge of your seat.

One of the best aspects of Grand Theft Auto 5 is its replayability. With so many different options and choices to make, the game never feels repetitive or boring. Whether you want to play through the story again or try out new ways of exploring the city, there is always something new to discover.

The online component of Grand Theft Auto 5 is also exceptional. It allows you to play with friends and strangers in a massive online world that is filled with opportunities for both cooperative and competitive gameplay.

In conclusion, Grand Theft Auto 5 is a must-play game for anyone who enjoys open world, action-packed gaming experiences. It sets a new standard for what is possible in a game and offers endless hours of fun and excitement. If you haven’t played it yet, you are truly missing out on one of the greatest games of all time.

applist.name: Monument Valley 2: Panoramic Edition
applist.detailed_description:
Perception meets reality in Monument Valley 2, the atmospheric return of the acclaimed smash hit Monument Valley. Explore, Grow and Guide Ro and her Child through a magical and moving world.

Discover illusionary pathways and delightful puzzles as you learn the secrets of The Sacred Geometry.

In this meditative and calming puzzle game, follow the heart warming story of Ro in her journey through motherhood. Rediscover independence through manipulating monuments and evolving paths to explore new, surreal, and mysterious worlds.

The Award Winning Series Returns

  • Welcome back to the world of magical and mysterious monuments in Monument Valley 2, the award-winning sequel to the critically acclaimed Monument Valley.
  • Featuring brand-new environments and puzzles to explore, Monument Valley 2 is a surreal and beautiful experience, with an mistakably unique art style inspired by optical illusions that will keep players feeling in awe.
  • As you make your way through Ro and her child’s adventure, there will always be exciting and mysterious mechanics to unlock, and new friends to meet along the way.

Beautifully Unique

  • A critically acclaimed sequel to Monument Valley, Monument Valley 2 returns you to the world of magical and mysterious architecture in a completely stand-alone adventure. You don’t need to have played the original Monument Valley to be able to enjoy this experience. The game features brand new worlds and unique puzzles to explore.

Simple For All

  • Click and drag to reshape the world and help Ro and her Child explore breathtaking yet impossible areas. Designed to be easy for everyone to pick up, enjoy and complete. Monument Valley 2: Panoramic Edition is the biggest and best way to play Monument Valley 2 yet.

A New Way to Play

  • With an entirely new control scheme reimagined for PC, you can interact with the universe of Monument Valley in a unique and tactile way. Combined with an all-new panoramic way to play the game designed for Full HD and ultrawide displays, Monument Valley 2 is more awe-inspiring and beautiful than ever before.

Every Puzzle Included

  • Monument Valley 2: Panoramic Edition is the total collection of all Monument Valley 2 content - with every chapter added to make this the ultimate game to add to your collection. Taking influence from minimalist 3D design, optical illusions and ancient architecture from around the world, every monument is a unique, hand-crafted world to explore.

Two Is Better Than One

  • Monument Valley: Panoramic Edition and Monument Valley 2: Panoramic Edition are both available at an exclusive bundle price when purchased together on Steam. The Panoramic Collection is the best way to play the Monument Valley series.






ustwo games are proud independent developers, best known for the award-winning Monument Valley series, Land’s End, Assemble with Care and Alba: A Wildlife Adventure.

reviews.review:
A great experience, same as the first one: Incredible soundtrack, great level design and low difficulty puzzles for a relaxing and very enjoyable experience.
A couple of things change from the already extraordinary original MV, such as the plot (abstract as it is) which is a moving mother-daughter journey and some new mechanics for the puzzles. Levels are also maybe a bit shorter, so the overall time needed to complete the game is lower.
Not much to add, just enjoy the peaceful, captivating ride!
Fun puzzles, astounding music and audio design. A great acid trip prequel/10

applist.name: Sniper Elite 5
applist.detailed_description:
Season Pass Two Roadmap


Season Pass One Roadmap



Deluxe Edition includes Season Pass One


Join Us On Discord


About the Game



The latest instalment in the award-winning series, Sniper Elite 5 offers unparalleled sniping, tactical third-person combat and an enhanced kill cam. Fight your way across the most immersive maps yet, with many real-world locations captured in stunning detail, and an improved traversal system that lets you explore more of them than ever before.

France, 1944 – As part of a covert US Rangers operation to weaken the Atlantikwall fortifications along the coast of Brittany, elite marksman Karl Fairburne makes contact with the French Resistance. Soon they uncover a secret Nazi project that threatens to end the war before the Allies can even invade Europe: Operation Kraken.



EXPANSIVE CAMPAIGN
Many real-world locations have been captured using photogrammetry to recreate a living, immersive environment, and multiple infiltration and extraction points and kill list targets provide a whole new perspective on each mission. Take on the Nazi plot solo or work with a partner, with improved co-op mechanics allowing you to share ammo and items, give orders and heal each other.



ADVANCED GUNPLAY PHYSICS AND TRAVERSAL
Use ziplines, slide down slopes and shimmy along ledges to reach the perfect vantage point, or to sneak past a sharp-eyed lookout. Factor in rifle stock and barrel options along with gravity, wind and heart rate while you line up your sights on the target.



HIGH CALIBRE CUSTOMISATION
Use workbenches to customise and upgrade virtually every aspect of your weapon – change scopes, stocks, barrels, magazines and more. Rifles, secondaries and pistols all have a huge variety of options. On top of that you can select the ammo to suit your target, from armour-piercing right down to non-lethal.

INVASION MODE – CAMPAIGN DROP IN PvP AND CO-OP
Invade another player’s Campaign as an Axis sniper and engage in a deadly game of cat and mouse, providing a new dimension to the challenge as you stalk your prey. Alternatively, as Karl you can call for assistance and have a second sniper drop in to help you out of a tricky situation.

TENSE ADVERSARIAL MULTIPLAYER
Customise your character and loadout and earn XP, medals and ribbons as you take on intensely competitive 16 player battles that will really test your sharpshooting skills. If co-op’s more your style, you can team up with up to 3 other players against waves of enemies in Survival mode.



ENHANCED KILL CAM
More realistic and grisly than ever, the trademark X-ray kill cam returns, showing you the true destructive power of each shot. Bones deflect bullets unpredictably, ripping a new path through enemy bodies. SMGs and pistols can also trigger kill cams, including multiple shots in dramatic slow motion.

Use ziplines, slide down slopes and shimmy along ledges to reach the perfect vantage point, or to sneak past a sharp-eyed lookout. Factor in rifle stock and barrel options along with gravity, wind and heart rate while you line up your sights on the target.



HIGH CALIBRE CUSTOMISATION
Use workbenches to customise and upgrade virtually every aspect of your weapon – change scopes, stocks, barrels, magazines and more. Rifles, secondaries and pistols all have a huge variety of options. On top of that you can select the ammo to suit your target, from armour-piercing right down to non-lethal.

INVASION MODE – CAMPAIGN DROP IN PvP AND CO-OP
Invade another player’s Campaign as an Axis sniper and engage in a deadly game of cat and mouse, providing a new dimension to the challenge as you stalk your prey. Alternatively, as Karl you can call for assistance and have a second sniper drop in to help you out of a tricky situation.

TENSE ADVERSARIAL MULTIPLAYER
Customise your character and loadout and earn XP, medals and ribbons as you take on intensely competitive 16 player battles that will really test your sharpshooting skills. If co-op’s more your style, you can team up with up to 3 other players against waves of enemies in Survival mode.



ENHANCED KILL CAM
More realistic and grisly than ever, the trademark X-ray kill cam returns, showing you the true destructive power of each shot. Bones deflect bullets unpredictably, ripping a new path through enemy bodies. SMGs and pistols can also trigger kill cams, including multiple shots in dramatic slow motion.
applist.short_description: The award-winning series returns as Karl Fairburne fights to uncover Project Kraken in 1944 France. The genre-defining authentic sniping, with enhanced kill cam, has never looked or felt better as you fight across immersive maps to stop the Nazi war machine in its tracks.

movies.name: Sniper Elite 5 - Kill Cam Enhanced Trailer

reviews.review: Rebellion continues to make great games but really bad business practice with Downloadable Content and throttling the amount of features players get for further monetization

I enjoyed the previous two games. I wanted a better quality game with a new story but a game that was basically "more of the same". I think this is exactly that.

The idea of some rando coming into my single player game and forcing me to change my preferred slow and methodical gameplay style seemed like a terrible idea. The cool thing about the invasion mechanic is you can set it to friends only, or turn it off entirely. That's what I did for my first playthrough of the campaign. I had a blast. The invasion mechanic is actually really cool if you want to play through the game again. I'm in the process of getting all the achievements and medals currently. It's fun to have others turn up in my game and give me some fun PvP interactions. It's also to load into someone else's game and try and slowly hunt them down. The 4 person survival modes are a ton of fun. They really bring out the fun in using some of the secondaries provided. My campaign playthrough was mostly rifle for distance, pistol for close quarters. Survival was the SMG's and shotguns time to shine. I don't really have an opinion on multiplayer matches, I've not really played much of any of the game modes. I'm currently playing through the campaign again with a friend in co-op and it's a lot of fun. Something I really appreciate is the ability to switch to first person view on all guns. That's my preferred way to play.

Not much of a groundbreaking review to be fair. I liked the previous games, I liked this one with invasions turned off. I liked playing again with invasions turned on. I liked doing the invasions myself. I recommend it.
Game repeatedly insists on telling my browser to open a web page on the Epic Games website. This is out of order for multiple reasons.
Good game but very bad update management. Must download huge updates that almost the same as game size.

Fun game sneaking around popping Nazis.
My only complaint is about the invisible walls that stop you going into advantageous  areas. Its gotten me killed a couple of times.  Like you have these large open maps (which I like)great for planning out how you get in &out only to have your emergency run way route blocked by an invisible wall :-/
If you liked the other games in the series, you'll like this game....simple.

Others manage to optimize update size, meanwhile here every update is 40+ GB to download.
Despite this the game is ok.

By comparison with the last offering (SE4), this game is a disappointment.  If you can start the game at all (lots of reports that people can't), and if you play without crashing (lots of people complaining about crashes), and if you can put up with bugs that are being "looked into" for months, and if you can run the game long enough for memory leaks not to send you crashing, then you can play.

Survival mode is a disappointment, lacks the luster SE4 had for replayability, and has coding issues where sometimes poor spawns or out-of-bounds vehicles end your game.  Also too few maps.

The maps are beautiful in most cases, but there is repetition (designer laziness) in some of them and you are not as free as you'd like to be.

Wind effects do not compare with SE4 unfortunately, and also there is no authentic plus mode, both of which make the game less challenging than most would welcome.

Weapon modifications are too complex and silly, too overdone.  And some weapons that should appear do not.

The game is geared towards console warriors, and the game is cross-platform.  PC Steam users do not get the attention of the developers in the forums.  The most you will get is some lame acknowledgement (sometimes, not the majority of time either) that they read the issue, then you get told to contact support, who does nothing in most cases.

Updates are still 40 GB and up, all the time.  "We are working on it"

Most maps are not sniper-generous.

I enjoyed the single player campaign, but replayability is not as good as SE4.  If you play multiplayer, be prepared for a host of cheaters and disappointments there, IMO mostly because of all the console action that is now in the game.

The game is very short and steam keeps pushing out very large updates that have ate up all my hard drive space.  If I were you, I would wait until they get all the bugs worked out and the price is lower. Not worth the money.

The game does not work as it should, it lags and you get FPS drops all the time.
The recommendation and the minimum requirements cannot be exceeded, I have a little more than the recommendation requirements but still cannot play the game.

this game is underrated by some. but not for me. with the upgrades, it plays well and has great detail that can make missions long if you care to try to do everything before exiting a mission. I have played the other sniper elite games and this one is just as good.( after the upgrades.) It will run well on any midgrade system.( I use and nvidia 1060 video card and an i5 prcessor.  well worth the money especially if on sale.
Sniper Elite 4 just worse

Might revise this later, but Steam keeps asking. My answer right now, 6 hours in, is no, I wouldn't recommend it. Too many invisible walls (can't get over top of a picnic table all of a sudden) and spontaneously generated enemies (I walk down a flight of stairs, and enemies spawn right behind me. 

In all the SE games,  he moves his head incredibly slowly when looking thru a scope or binoculars. If an enemy is moving at all, it's impossible to keep up with them, and therefore shoot anyone who is moving, ever.

Pros:
- The game can be passed without killing anyone (except those who must be killed as objectives - would be nice if that was tackled as well).
- Very beautiful. Lots of attention to details.
- Sniper rifles have a new distance based aiming mechanic. Still it's a far cry from what Sniper Contracts offers.

Cons:
- Plastic faces. I've never seen so bad faces in a AAA title. Crysis from 2007 looked better.
- Horrible terrible stupid AI. I'm playing on authentic and it's just not there. AI won't see you when you're right in front of it. AI will however spot you when you're crouching 50 meters away.
- Not a lot of new stuff if any in comparison to previous installments.
- IRL something that's guarded is guarded at all times. Without ifs. That means it's ridiculous that you can sneak in almost everywhere without being spotted.
- I can pick up a fourth gun which is the same as mine but with better modifications or the one which is not yet available, why? I can use it. If I switch to my own primary three guns, this fourth gun is dropped. What the hell? Found modifications are not unlocked by picking better guns.
- Enemies popping out of thin air. This happens e.g. when you destroy objects and you have enemies "sleeping".
- Not enough traversal freedom. Too many areas of the game are blocked seemingly for no reasons.

Buy only when it's on sale.
The same great feeling with the previous entries!

My first impression was that the graphics weren't up to date. However this can be changed but even on ultra mode i feel like they could be better. I also feel like the story wasn't as good as sniper elite 4 it's still worth it for the gameplay in my opinion. They added a few new features which surprised me but in a good way for instance they removed the golden skins and replaced them with camo varients which are unlockable by finding a workbench or achieving a specific amount of kills. One of the things i like alot about this franchise are the unique maps they out did themselfs definitly an improvement from their latest release the vr version which i assume has smaller maps because of the vr technology not being great yet. 
Conclusion you shouldn't buy it for the story/graphics but for the gameplay.

Unable to play Multiplayer.
After recent updates it's not even launching
An hour and a half of trouble shooting, port forwarding and searching for fixes and I still cannot play co-op with my friend. Error 12011 GG waste of money.

If you enjoyed the others, you'll like this one. Nobody plays these for their riveting story or fleshed out characters because it honestly has neither. This game is all about sniping Nazis and being an overall menace to society. Looks great, sounds great, plays great. Nice selection of guns, although a few from earlier in the series locked behind DLC, but from what I see we're not missing much if you haven't bought them. If you're new, don't worry, you won't be lost story wise or gameplay wise. Play this for cathartic Nazi sniping action with some badass slo-mo cameras.
Won't launch correctly half the time and crashes quite a bit.

applist.name: Outward Definitive Edition
applist.detailed_description:
Special Offer

If you own the original base game and The Three Brothers DLC on PC, you can redeem a free digital copy of Outward Definitive Edition.


DISCORD


About the Game

The Definitive Edition delivers the ultimate experience for Outward players.

Experience the overhauled and complete Outward experience in the Definitive Edition, which natively includes the content of The Soroboreans and The Three Brothers. Beside the new weapons, dungeons and unique mechanics, you can also expect quality of life improvements. Adventurers, now is your best chance to explore the world of Aurai!



Outward delivers an immersive RPG experience coupled with survival gameplay, offering a deeply-rewarding challenge for the most avid gamers.



Just your everyday traveler
As an ordinary adventurer, you’ll not only have to hide or defend yourself against threatening creatures, but also brave the hazardous environmental conditions, protect yourself against infectious diseases, make sure you get enough sleep, and stay hydrated. Embark on perilous expeditions across untamed lands to reach new cities, undertake varied missions and discover hidden dungeons crawling with formidable enemies.



Tackle the challenges solo or co-op
In order to survive in the dazzling yet deadly world of Aurai, you’ll have to be cunning, clever and prepared. Devise diverse strategies to defeat your foes and don’t neglect your basic needs, sharing your journey with a friend, locally or online.



City Building Mechanic: Rebuilding Sirocco:
Create your own landmark in Aurai by helping the population to survive in this ruthless world! With the new City Building mechanic, you are part of rebuilding the Refugee Camp into New Sirocco.



Enchantment System
Armor up and get stronger as you can enhance your weapons, trinkets and armors through the enchanting system! From increasing damage, weather resistance, elemental damage, personalization and even more, you will find your perfect enchantment among over 85 recipes.

The Outward Experience:
  • Survive in the wilds as you explore the land
  • Play solo or cooperatively, split screen locally or online
  • Ritualistic, step-by-step approach to spellcasting
  • Constant auto-saving means you must live with your decisions
  • Encounter dynamic defeat scenarios
  • A unique experience with every playthrough
